Reviews.Title: “Horrible - Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: 70anonymous
Reviews.Content: This was the classic bait and switch Italian style. This hotel is dishonest and unprofessional. I'm a reporter who travels extensively for work in the U.S. and this was the worst hotel experience I have ever had. My husband and I booked this hotel for our honeymoon. I searched for hotels on kayak.com on the mobile app, found Hotel Dei Consoli, thought it was a descent deal and kayak redirected me to bookings.com. I input all my credit card information and a confirmation screen popped up saying my booking for Dependence Hotel Dei Consoli was successful. I couldn't figure out why there was suddenly an extra word in the hotel name. I looked it up on the main hotel's website. The hotel said it had additional rooms in an apartment building 400 meters away called Dependence. Immediately I contacted bookings.com and they said only the hotel could let me out of the reservation. The hotel manager, Ripari Samuels, sent a belligerent and highly unprofessional email, which I've uploaded. The main hotel website described the Dependence rooms as in an apartment building 400 meters from the main hotel, as newly renovated with marble floors, airconditioning, a view of Rome and a safe. The rooms were actually in another hotel called Hotel Amalia. The rooms were not renovated. There was no safe, there was no airconditioning, a 70's blowdryer, a mildewed shower, cracked linoleum floors, a filthy duvet so worn it had holes in it and torn and stained sheets. There was a chair so dirty and stained I had to put a towel down to sit on it. To sum it up, this property is closer to a youth hostel than a hotel room. Hotel Dei Consoli should be ashamed of themselves for using their name to sell subpar rooms in another hotel and their staff need serious training in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: HampshireMaz
Reviews.Content: My friend and I travelled to Rome for the first time on the 16th March and stayed 5 nights at this lovely hotel, which is situated very close to the Vatican. The rooms are small but very clean and comfortable and the buffet breakfast, which is served on the roof terrace, is delicious. With the help and support from Samuel and Fabrizio we were able to get around on the buses and the metro very easily. There are lots of restaurants in the vicinity. A stroll across the river takes you to places such as the Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. We would certainly recommend that you book online in advance of your trip to visit the Vatican and also the Colosseum. It saves queuing. We would definitely stay at this hotel again when staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: sheilaNottsUk
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time at this hotel it is located on a quiet street near to some great shopping and some reasonable priced restaurants,the vatican is very close and we walked to a lot of the locations such as trevi fountain,the pantheon.The river is close and makes a nice walk during the day or night,reception staff very helpful with directions and map reading as signs are not the italians strong point! the rooms are compact but elegant, marble bathrooms very nice only problem was our spa bath was not working but we didnt mention it as it was only a minor issue,the rooms are spotless as is the hotel,breakfast on the lovely terrace is great, a good choice by italian standards yummy cakes too! wish they had bigger cups in italy as the cappuchinos are wonderful and had to ask for refils! The metro is very close so you can reach places such as the colloseum etc we had no problems here the room was quiet and we had peaceful nights there is a nice wine bar nearby which we used to go and soak up the wonderful atmosphere only wish we had stayed longer but we are planning to return next year to see the other parts we missed we used the hotels limo service to and from the airport and this was very efficient...we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel, Great Location Near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: KBaldwin_10
Reviews.Content: Located on a very small street, Dei Consoli is a lovely boutique hotel in a great location. It's a stone's throw from the vatican in an area with great shopping. The rooms are small, but with great appointments....love the bathrooms. There's s roof top terrace where the great breakfast is served. The terrace is also a great place to have wine or limoncello at night! There's a neighborhood restaurant across the small street that we return to again and again. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant service”
Reviews.Author: Phillip P
Reviews.Content: I made my first visit to Rome on 02 March 2012 and stayed in Hotel Dei Consoli . Not being able to speak Italian It was very helpful to to be met and dealt with ,with great friendliness and able to communicate English.The service given by the Staff especially Samuel and Fabrisio was excellent. They were able to give directions to very good entertainment and transport around the area,and made our stay a very pleasant and enjoyable one. I would like also to praise the Hotel on the rooms and pleasant staff .I would certainly recommend this Hotel to all who want a very pleasant stay in Rome. Thank you again from Phillip &Bernadette Perrett also Peter & Una Daly.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to the Vatican - Cinsotory”
Reviews.Author: BillK1133
Reviews.Content: Staff especially Sam was outstanding in helpful suggestions ans setting up reservations and Guided Rome Tour. Rooms was very nice and the Terrace was very comfortable for Breakfast and a quick dinner after a long day at the Vatican most of which spent in Line.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: caliroan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week during the Feb. 2012 Papal Consistory. It was the perfect location for our purposes - near but not on the tourist beaten path. Quick walk to the Vatican. Rooms are small but clean and quiet. Breakfast on the 4th floor terrace was the same every day, but with enough variety that it didn't get boring. Scrambled eggs, bacon, selection of meats, cheeses, cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, and pastries. The hotel is in the Prati neighborhood, just steps from one of the best shopping streets in Rome - Via Cola di Rienzo. It's a mix of elegant boutiques and more affordable shopping options including a Coin department store. During my February visit, there were all sorts of sales with "sconti" up to 70% in some stores. Boggi Milano across the street has beautiful menswear, and for purses and leather goods, check out Coccinelle nearby - this chic but well-priced brand has only two stores, so my fashion-conscious wife appreciated having a label that you don't see everywhere. The Taverna Varrone right across the street serves good food at reasonable prices. My only complaint - the front desk recommended I hire a car service for a few hours when I had several stops to make. Cost me 150 euros; I would have been much better off just catching taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location; nice rooms; nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Oberst06
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights while in Rome for the Papal Consistory. The location is an easy walk to the Vatican and across the Tiber to some decent restaurants (including Ad Hoc). The rooms are small by US standards, but more than adequate for one person; the bathrooms are fairly nice. Everything was spotless. Very nice roof deck, which is comfortable even in winter with clear plastic screening, and a nice breakfast. Sam, the manager, was most helpful and arranged a driver/guide (Massimilo) who was one of the better guides I've ever used. Fausto, the bartender, was also a delight and makes a great cappuccino.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shyte
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent safe area near transport (bus/metro)20 meters from an ellegant avenue not in the middle of tourist area. Really clean and tide! The guys in the desk (Fabrizio, Samuel, Denis) superb! very polite, helpfull always with a smile!! we really felt fine. The breackfast in the roof garden was awesome finest products and super complete! (bacon, scrumbled eggs, toasts, jelly, cookies, cakes, cheese, ham, salami, juices, coffee etc.) the San Pietro dome sight and the green plants, lemon trees, that sourround the winter garden space! The rooms neat, with everithing you should need, well decorated (just to say something the TV set very tiny and old). The bathroom complete and well decorated also! Thank u guys for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not 4*”
Reviews.Author: Mark J
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was the high point. The staff were friendly, breakfast was decent, the rooms were ok but the place needs a good clean. There was a used tissue on the floor and a bag under the bed and the place just didn't look like it had seen a vacuum cleaner for a while. I'm not sure how the star system works but I've stayed in equivalent accommodation of 2/3 stars. If we hadn't got a great deal on this place and had to pay full price I wouldn't've been happy but it was cheap considering the proximity to the Vatican. The bed was hard and there was street noise in the night but beds are personal things and noise is expected in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location, would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Kerryannewalsh
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a surprise gift for my boyfriend's 21st and notified the hotel of this, they very kindly gave us a complimentary drink to celebrate. On arrival the receptionists were very kind and welcoming. The room was small but big enough as we weren't really in there much, only to sleep as we were out all day and the view from the room out on to the shops and amazing buildings was lovely. The receptionists we're very helpful, giving us advice on what was the best transport to get to the main features of rome and also with their reccomendations of the nicest restaurants near. The situation of the hotel was great, two minute walk to the Vatican and all the main transport where we hopped on a city tour bus which went to all of the main Places you need to see when in Rome. We would reccomend doing this as its the easiest way to get around and not to miss anything out, especially the coliseum! Breakfast was a small selection but it was enough and there was a new choice of foods out everyday. On departure from the hotel our transport was late which we were panicking about but the kind receptionist rang the shuttle bus company to see where they were as we could not speak Italian, he helped portray our worries to the shuttle driver who in turn made us his priority. The receptionist was very reassuring in a time of great stress and we would like to thank him for this. I would definitely reccomend anyone to stay here as it is a lovely hotel with brilliant, friendly staff in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “I would return there for all of my visits to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Carolpa_11
Reviews.Content: Warm, friendly, well situated, and a beautiful setting!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure stay”
Reviews.Author: Griga C
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, with friendly staff, excellent acommodation and superb location! Would definitely come again! Short walk to the Vatican city and other Romes attraction, I kindly recommend this boutique hotel to anyone who wish to spend a lovely stay in the Eternal City! Iuliana & Cosmin from Pitesti, Romania

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johanna R
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel within walking distance of the Vatican, restaurants and high end shops. Close to public transportation and walking distance to major sites. Beautiful decor, immaculate rooms, excellent service. Very quiet-could not hear traffic or other guests. The roof top restaurant was lovely-full breakfast included. The staff was extremely helpful and professional. I would recommend this to everyone and will definitely stay here again on a return trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: oharasteph
Reviews.Content: Short walk to vatican and metro. Within walking 20 minutes walk of Spanish steps, Trevi fountain and Piazza Navona with lots to see in between. Rooms small but comfortable and clean. Breakfast adequate. Would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel. In the immediate area there are plenty of shops and reasonably priced restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great price, Great service!!”
Reviews.Author: Shawn H
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here in late October 2011. The property was very nice, comfortable, and VERY close walking distance to Saint Peter's Square. The decor, hallways, and rooms were definitely designed in a European theme and this was an extra touch as I always want to feel as if I'm NOT in a U.S. hotel when in Europe. I cannot say enough great superlatives about Fabricio at the front desk. He is a very polite man, works during the day, and speaks good english with a nice sense of humor. He assisted us with luggage without expecting a tip and called a taxi for us to the airport that was reasonably priced. Fabricio adds an extra special touch to the experience in a great way!! The top of the property is their crown jewel. We enjoyed a great dinner at night, the complimentary breakfast is fantastic, and the views of St. Peter's Basilica from the roof are nice. Unlimited refills of good, bold coffee are on-hand in the mornings served in white china. Do the math and this complimentary hot breakfast with servers would easily cost you 15-20 euros a person. Factor this cost savings into their already low rate for this location and they provide an excellent value for the money spent per night. Great looking property and close to nice restaurants and shopping if you choose. 3 minute walk to the Vatican/Square. Fabricio made our stay that more enjoyable!! Thanks buddy!

Reviews.Title: “Superb boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: maw633
Reviews.Content: Great hotel within 10 minutes walk of the Vatican and the metro. We made the most of the good weather and walked to all the main sites from the hotel including the Forum, Colosseum and Spanish Steps. The room was a good size for a boutique hotel with a large bed, ample storage and a decent bathroom. The roof terrace was an added bonus, a great place to enjoy breakfast or an evening drink (or two!) Service wise, the hotel did a fantastic job. The staff were extremely welcoming and helpful; providing maps, suggesting good places to eat and organising transfers. I was emailing the hotel the night before to arrange final details and the majority of the staff spoke very good English. If we go back to Rome we will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Roof Top Terrace”
Reviews.Author: mack15
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel for our last night in Rome based on the reviews. It turned out to be everything we were expecting. The hotel was within very close walking distance to the Vatican which was the main reason we stayed here for our last night. We had just completed an organized Tour of Italy and were looking for a nice quite stay for the end of our trip. We had dinner and drinks at the Roof Top Terrace Bar and it was a special evening to complete our trip. The staff were all very friendly and helpful (especially Sam) including arranging our transportation to the airport. We booked this hotel online using TripAdvisor and were very pleased with the value of our selection. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that is looking for a small quality property with great service located very close to the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our trip”
Reviews.Author: Carol01Texas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Dei Consoli for 3 nights at the beginning of our two week Italy trip. A few days before arriving, I contacted the staff regarding some questions I had about getting to the hotel. Within minutes of my email, Sam wrote me back, and helped arrange transportation for our group of 6 to the hotel. He also contacted a tour service for me, since we would be on our flight to Europe in the time frame I was supposed to get in touch with them. Arriving at the hotel, we felt like we were visiting old friends. Fabrizio welcomed us, and got us settled. When I finally met Sam in person, he was as charming in person as he seemed to be in his email. Both Sam and Fabrizio cheerfully greeted us each day, and always knew if others in our party were already in, or still out - part of that has to do with leaving your key with them as you leave, but they were very "in tune" with what was going on with their guests. They helped us figure out how best to get around the city, and get home safely. The hotel is very close to Vatican City, and also close to where locals live, so that things quiet down considerably once the stores in the area close. Taking Bus 81 is very easy and convenient to go to the other attractions. Our room was small but very comfortable - excellent air conditioning - it was fairly warm when we were there, and enjoyed a cool room at the end of a long day. Our group of 8 found the lounge area on the first floor of rooms a great place to gather and visit. The terrace is lovely for breakfast, or just sitting and enjoying the view and getting away from the crowds. We had drinks and a snack the first evening there just before our Rome by Night tour. Sam told us to enjoy ourselves, and he would let us know when our tour guide arrived. This boutique hotel is family owned, and they treat you like their personal guest. I would recommend Hotel Dei Consoli to anyone for good value, location, and top notch service to their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mdDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights. The room was small but clean and adequate, with good air-conditioning. Good sound-proofing. Walking distance to St Peter's and the Vatican. Convenient bus nearby to central and old Rome (No. 81). Very helpful and cheerful guys at the desk, Fabriccio ("proud to be a Roman") and Sam - they provided a lot of guidance and advice. Adequate breakfast on the top floor (no variety from day to day). Would be happy to stay again. No tea or coffee facilities in the room, though!

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: Small boutique hotel with tons of charm. Small rooms, but what else would one expect in Rome? Desk staff was extremely helpful and the roof top terrace breakfast was a delight. Sounds of the city below and St. Peter's dome in the distance. Walking distance to the Vatican Museum and St. Peter's, and very close to the open-air on/off tour busses that circle all the sights in Rome. Had technical difficulties accessing the (paid) Internet service and they gladly refunded our fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: saratonk
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it had special rate at the time on expedia. It’s a lovely little hotel, friendly clean and with helpful staff. The roof terrace is a great place to have breakfast and evening drinks. The food is really good. The air con a blessing and the rooms were virtually soundproof despite our room overlooking the main road.The location is excellent for visits to the Vatican City and St Peters square. Top tip for visiting these, you can pre book tickets online for Vatican City/Sistine chapel etc and also the coliseum. Just go to the official museums website, also Sistine chapels gardens tour is the only way you can get into seeing the inside of the Vatican City and it’s really interesting. Its well worth pre-booking as the queues are massive. It’s also a great feeling walking to the front of the queue and going straight in  Another tip, for sightseeing August isn’t the best time to go to Rome, it is very hot.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: victoria d
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel based on other reviews and couldn't have been happier - this is the perfect spot for a city break without the kids. Location is great for sightseeing and eating, and we loved the terrace for breakfast and drinks. As other reviewers have mentioned, the rooms are pretty small (but who goes to Rome just to sit around in a hotel room anyway?). The staff were super friendly and special thanks to Sam who went out of his way to make suggestions for places that tourists wouldn't normally find! We would certainly stay here again if we're ever back in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful terrace, Prati location near Vatican”
Reviews.Author: GrandestTour
Reviews.Content: The highlight was the terrace with its colorful ceramics and pretty tables. Perfect for drinks, chat, or a read. Also, the Prati location is a pleasant walk to Vatican Museums, St Peter's, or a shopper's dream. Nearby the fantastic, pricey food shop Franchi made for a tasty lunch or dinner to go (alas, at restaurant prices), consumed on the lovely hotel terrace. My room (booked last-minute, high season) was tiny, of which I was apologetically informed in advance. But there was a lovely meeting room that was perfect when I needed to work. Lovely owners, too, who are very present on the premises, keep things running smoothly. Very helpful desk clerk, Samuel. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: juc92020
Reviews.Content: Location, location! My husband and I stayed at the recommendation of friends and were very pleased with the hotel. Located within a few blocks of St Peters and l block to a main bus transit center plus super shopping street is a big plus. Breakfast on the roof top was always a great way to start the day. Rooms weren't super fancy but well appointed, nice large bathroom, ours opened with big windows to the street but wasn't noisy at all. Front desk concierge men always very accommodating and friendly as was the breakfast staff . Only small problem was that the late afternoon/early evening ability to have a drink on the patio limited because of prebooked events. (Easily accommodated by nearby hotels and small restaurants nearby). Do take an "on and off" bus tour if you haven't been to the city before and need to get acclimated...helps on that first day. Take the earliest tour available of St Peters/Sistine - the museum gets ridiculously crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hospitality, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kelcee1049
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quiet, hospitable, and warm; the rooms are very adequate and clean. The rooftop terrace breakfast was a treat. A short walk takes you to St. Peter's Square, shopping, the bus stop and subway. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Asseneta
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel del Consoli the weekend of July 1-3, 2011. We were in Rome for a friends' wedding and wanted to do some sightseeing in our spare time. The hotel is located walking distance to the Vatican and about 40min walk to the historical centre of Rome. The rooms are very spacious and clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. We had breakfast included in the room rate, which was served on the terrace, which is a lovely addition to the hotel. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it and planning to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: sarahkr01
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Hotel dei Consoli from June 21 through June 26! The hotel's location is amazing! It is within perfect walking distance to all the main attractions (Vatican, Castel Sant'Angelo, Piazza Navona, Piazza del Popolo). Great shopping right outside the front door and close to the Metro. We arrived in the evening so tired from traveling and were greeted by Sam at the Hotel. He was amazing! He made reservations at a fantastic restaurant (L'Eccellenza) right down the street from the hotel. He also gave us a map with several suggestions of places we should go (at night and during the day). He was fantastic and made our honeymoon in Rome so much more enjoyable! The hotel rooms are small compared to american hotel rooms, but they were perfect to serve as our base for our time in Rome. The rooftop terrace breakfast was a fantastic way to start every day! The food was good (eggs, proscuitto, croissants, fruit) and the coffee was delicious! The hotel is perfect walking distance from many sites in Rome (Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Vatican, Castel Sant'Angelo) and within walking distance to the Metro to get to ancient Rome and other popular sites. In the evening the neighborhood is safe to walk around for dinner or just late evening sight seeing. We had dinners late at several Piazza's and never once felt unsafe walking back to the hotel at night. We had a fantastic trip and decided that we are definately going back to Italy and staying at the Hotel dei Consoli!

Reviews.Title: “we absolutely loved it and will always stay there when in rome!”
Reviews.Author: hinckm
Reviews.Content: great location small but extremely comfortable. Able to access all Rome sites with ease. Room not large but more than adequate and very well appointed. Super clean. Bathroom very roomy. Best part of the hotel was the welcoming feeling from everyone we encountered from desk clerk to owners. Stayed here when we first arrived in Rome for two days and reserved again for a night at the end of our vacation. When we returned we were immediately welcomed and we felt like family. Have not experienced this at the many hotels we've stayed in over many years of travel. Do not be put off by the small foyer when you enter the best is yet to come. Roof garden restaurant a welcome haven at the end of a long day of sightseeing. Great food and wine in a relaxing environment. Enjoyed the evenings spent there.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tom1234Philadelphia
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Hotel dei Consoli. The front desk staff were always cordial and were very helpful with advice on directions and transportation. Breakfast is served on the pleasant roof-top terrace and again the staff made you feel welcome and comfortable. The rooms are small, but quiet and the beds comfortable. If you're coming to Rome to experience the city, you're in a great location, just steps from the Vatican and easy access to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Hankin76
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel after the reading the good reviews, sometimes you cannot trust trip advisor. The room was tiny, (and I live in a 1 bedroom flat in London, so I know small) we were just about able to walk around our bed but not at the same time . At over £300 for two nights, it is a long time since i have seen a 14" portable tv. Sadly there was only hand towels for the first day, The Jacuzzi did not work. My iphone was better than the laptop in reception. i did raise all the issues above with Reception but the hotel was full, even though we only saw 5 other guests. Another point I asked for a Iron and was told in Italy no Irons are allowed in hotel rooms, but there was no alternatives laid on by hotel to address this issue. Plus points location is great, nested in between some great shops and we walked to the Vatican within 15 minutes. The house wine we received on arrival was the best wine i tasted all weekend. The breakfast was good, and the roof balcony is great for breakfast, and it is very clean. I cannot recommend this hotel based on room size, lack of 4 star amenities and finally the price i paid, but it does have some plus points.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tlbden
Reviews.Content: Nice location close to the Vatican. The rooms are small but very comfortable. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. Thanks especially to Laura for arranging a very nice dinner at L'eccelenza nearby. The roof garden is very nice for breakfast or a glass of wine at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: JJandJJfromFL
Reviews.Content: If you like a boutique style hotel with lots of personal service, please take a look at this one. It took me hours to choose the "perfect" hotel in Rome but until we arrived I couldn't be sure. We were delighted with our choice. Great location, fastidiously clean and wonderful breakfast! We chose a suite and even with that, the room is quite small but hopefully you're only in the room to sleep. Everyone was friendly and helpful! Also, the hotel has incredible soundproofing so if your windows are closed you don't hear any noise at all!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, easy location and truly friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mari73Espoo
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent and buses run to the center from the nearby square regularly (81, 492). Nice even if very small rooms. Clean and well kept. The reception is really helpful with excellent tips about nearby restaurants or help with museum reservations. The gentleman responsible for breakfast is also extremely nice and friendly. Breakfast on the rooftop has a beautiful location and it's good, in an Italian scale at least. Overall pleasant, relaxing and welcoming hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: belfa186338
Reviews.Content: We have tonight just arrived home from four days in Rome and staying at the Hotel Dei Consoli .I don't know how to descibe our stay it was just magical the Staff are amazing especially Sam who is a credit to the Hotel he was so,so helpful with lots of useful information and ideas on where to go for amaxing meals and with his assistance we managed to get seats at St Peters Square on Easter Sunday to celebrate Mass by the Pope. The room was perfectly clean with clean towels and bedding changed daily Breakfast was plentiful and in a beautiful setting on the roof top with a lovely man who was more than helpful. Thank you for making our stay so wonderful and a perfect surprise birthday gift to somewhere I had always wanted to visit .Thank you Sam and all staff for making it so perfect in every way .Hope to see you again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Hard beds in small room”
Reviews.Author: OsloSigne
Reviews.Content: Just a few minutres walk from St Peters sq and the Vatican, the Dei Consoli is very convenient for a tourist. We got around town in a hop on-hop off sightseeing bus that stopped at the entry to the St Peters Sq. The metro is further away, not 50 m as stated on the web side, more like 700 m. The hotel has four stars, but appears very modest with just a reception desk at the bottom of a stair case. For 4 stars I had expected a more impressive reception and a more bustling atmosphere. The roof terrace is pleasant with blooming flowers, but empty except at breakfast. Breakfast was ok, but a very modest selection. No fresh fruit except a basket of oranges. Not inmpressive, or a breakfast that I would expect from a 4 star hotel. Pleasant and helpful staff. The rooms are clean, but very small. Our room (303) did not have a desk or a chair to relax in. The tv set was tiny (15'') and old fashioned. No free internet. That was certainly not as expected! The beds were very hard, and the duvet missing (just a rather tacky looking fleece/felt). The pillows were hard and heavy, and we got aching necks, We asked for a couple of softer pillows, which we got, but they were only a slight improvement. Tiny bathroom, good towels, good water pressure, but a dirty emergency cord in the shower gave an unhygienic impression. Very slow elevator. Noisy street. Ask for a room high up and towards back yard/side street. Safe in room too small for SLR camera or Ipad.

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: RoRodriguez
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel overall. It was only a few short blocks to the Vatican and to the train station. For the price, this is the best hotel to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: robertdana1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel... We were coming off a cruise.... Hotel arranged Taxi to pick us up. Rooms small BUT beds were comfortible...BETTER than most Italian hotels. The Deck is wonderful.. Location great for touring. We will go back ...5 Stars

Reviews.Title: “So Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: steffie_1
Reviews.Content: Was very disappointed with the hotel. We stayed in 5 different hotels on our trip to Italy, and this was by far the most disappointing. Room was so small, that you couldn't even walk around the bed with your small suitcase on the ground. One of the front desk attendees couldn't speak enough English to answer simple questions. Bed did not even get made up, nor towels delivered 2nd day, until we requested them late in the evening. The only of our 5 hotels that did not offer free wi-fi. We did pay for the wi-fi and then the connection was so incredibly slow, it took 5-10 minutes to just open our email account page. Hotel photos on webpage depict a charming hotel with a beautiful view. Had none of that. Didn't even have a view from the roof top terrace, as the buildings on each side of it were taller than it.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: wolf7
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three nights at this hotel and can honestly say we had no complaints at all,ideal postion for Vatican 10 minute walk from metro line and there is a pleasent resturant straight outside hotel,any questions we had where answerd, breakfast was fine always had clean sheets and towels and water plenty hot enough and to round day off nice bar on roof terace to drink a glass of wine or two ,would stay here again. wolf7

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: haveAnyIrish
Reviews.Content: No hot water on day 1. Staff very rude. Location is 750m from metro, not 50m as advertised. On the plus side it has some character and is right beside the vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Nice decent stay”
Reviews.Author: alexandrosg
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a nice location. Close to city centre and the Vatican. Nicely decorated rooms and very friendly staff. it is about 15 minutes walk to the centre (starting with Piazza Navona) but you can also take the tube or the bus. Nice breakfast as well, served at the roof garden. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another lovely stay at the Consoli”
Reviews.Author: thosetwo
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here many times, and written a couple of reviews. This was our second visit in 2010, and we are still quite happy with the Consoli. The staff is very friendly and helpful -- and they all do speak English (despite the claim of an earlier reviewer). Rooms are small (typically European) but comfortable and very clean (which should matter more than size!). Breakfast has good choices -- cereal, fruit, yogurt, meat, cheese, bread, scrambled eggs, dolci -- on the lovely roof terrace. And Fausto makes excellent cappuccino! The location is great, it's busy during the day but quiet at night. Enough good restaurants, caffees, and gelato stores nearby, but also close to subway and bus lines. We highly recommend it, especially in the off-season, when rates are lower.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: olsenjakob
Reviews.Content: I stayed for five days with my spouse. Hotel has excellent location on a very nice shopping-street. Close to the Vatican, and also within walking-distance of downtown, Campo de Fiori-quarter with great restaurants and cafees. Very professional and friendly staff, breakfast excellent, and roof-terrace with a great wiew. Rooms are a little bit small, but beautiful laid out. Amenities okay. Without hesitation, we will use this hotel again. Roman hotels are on the expensive side, but this hotel is very good value-for-money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value; great staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dave-Deb-H
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively small, but very nice hotel. They actually cater to business people, so get a lot of repeat business. Prices were very reasonable and the staff was very friendly and helpful (including providing translation services when a friend had an issue with the bank next door)!!!! Rooms were very nice, moderate size (by European standards). Roof top terrace was very nice for an evening bottle of wine (very reasonable!) and the sumptuous breakfasts. You can see the top of St Peters from there, but the view is not quite as accessible as their web site might infer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: lisazee113
Reviews.Content: Location was great. Staff was pleasant and accommodating (Fabrizo) was a great help and was so pleasant. The only draw back was the room was on the small side and made it difficult to maneuver. The hotel was very clean

Reviews.Title: “On good shopping street near Vatican (dutch review)”
Reviews.Author: Theo1952
Reviews.Content: Op hoek goede winkelstraat (via varrone). 10 minuten wandelen van historisch centrum. 5 minuten van metrostation. met ramen dicht rustige kamer. heel nette kamer. redelijk goed +royaal ontbijt (bacon/eggs/ koffie minder) =B&B/ geen restaurant. Schuintegenover goed restaurant (Zigaetana). Online gereserveerd via Easyjet (vlucht+hotel).

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly located small hotel run by the owner to the highest standards”
Reviews.Author: Gregory25
Reviews.Content: The proprietor of the Consoli is charming and very helpful to the older visitor who may have difficulty with reservations. The staff are well-trained and most helpful to the tourist. Upon arrival the welcome is warm though the small reception area is no indication of the beautifully furnished interior and the comfort of the rooms - with modern bathrooms, telephone and television. The hotel is situated in an excellent shopping area adjacent to the Vatican and very convenient for buses, the metro and trams to get around the city. In the warmer months of the year, an excellent breakfast is provided on the roof terrace (continental or full). A bar is provided on the terrace in the evenings. In the colder months breakfast is provided on the 1st floor. There are excellent restaurants nearfby the hotel though our preference is to take public transport to old favourite haunts tucked away in different parts of the city, for example outside the walls near Porta Pia and in Trastavere. The hotel is as warm and wonderful as the Eternal City itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great special place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ASeasonedTraveler060
Reviews.Content: Exceeded ALL our expectations (which were high to begin with). Went with my wife to celebrate my 60th birthday and our 33rd wedding anniversary. Wonderful in all respects. Outstanding staff (the front desk, especially Fabrizio, as well as the ownership) saw to our every need. They helped with sightseeing, selecting fine restaurants and making reservations, etc. 5-star all the way. Elegant, comfortable rooms (we had the junior suite facing the rear - very quiet) ; nice rooftop for breakfast and late night after dinner drinks - with a view of St. Peter's dome; easy walk to the Vatican, St. Peter's Basilica, the Vatican Museums - - as well as shopping and dining. Prior to our arrival, they even assisted our family/friends who wanted to surprise us with wine/champagne on arrival - which worked out perfectly. And they even gave me a birthday gift! A great special place.

Reviews.Title: “A very plesant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KateNYWhitestone_ny
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel in October for five nights. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The room was a a bit on the small side, but I have been told, that is the norm in Rome. We were a five minute walk to the Vatican. We had the convenience of being close to many attractions without any of the noise. The breakfast offered on the rooftop terrace is very nice as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant, but small room, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: EuroTraveler52
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome for the weekend to visit family. I am very familiar with Rome, and have stayed in this neighborhood on several occasions. As I knew this was a great location, I booked my stay here at the Hotel Dei Consoli. The staff was friendly and accomodating (which is not alway the case for many hotels in Rome). The room was well stocked with amenities, nicely decorated in a traditional style, and the climate control system worked very well. In addition, the windows were soundproofed, so, no street noise found its way into my room. The breakfast, served on the roof terrace, was very good, and the service was friendly and efficient. My only negative comments would be that both the room and bathroom were quite small, even by European standards. While this was perfectly fine as I was there alone, I would have to rule this hotel out if I was not travelling alone. However, with great service, and helpful staff, I was very pleased with my stay at the Hotel Dei Consoli, and would book here again on a solo visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location .....But noisy roof terrace at times!”
Reviews.Author: tela58
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Dei Consoli for 5 nights. Very clean Hotel, excellent location and staff very helpful. Our room was on 3rd floor and as mentioned in a previous review, we did experience alot of noise from the terrace above at all hours! That was the only negative point. Will return but ask not to be on 3rd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, wonderful room, and fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: JosephineAnne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Dei Consoli with two other couples, who are friends. The concierge staff helped us organize our trip before we arrived in Rome and throughout our stay. While we were there, they provided good referrals for restaurants and other specific shopping and touring needs. Plus they helped with our masses of luggage. The rooms were lovely (we all had double superior rooms) and a fair size by European standards. Further, the rooms were quiet and airconditioned. The location is hard to beat - great spot for tourists to walk to many places, or to hop on the subway. Don't forget to ask for the capuccino or expresso in the morning.. it is made fresh for you upon request only. There is access to WiFi, and it is relatively cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, nice roof terrace, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Flowerfairy
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here, it is a lovely hotel, in a great position. Nice room, lovely crisp bedlinen and fairly comfortable bed. Easy to get to the airport by catching the Metro to Termini and then you can get a bus from the bus station there for only EUR1.80 . We really enjoyed the two nights we spent there and made sure that we had a nice drink on the roof terrace each night overlooking St Pauls Basilica (only a few of the tables actually have this view) . Fabrizio was very helpful with any questions we had about how to get around Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel with Good Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: gvldiva
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our 2 days at the Dei Consoli.the 2nd weekend in September. TRANSPORTATION FROM AIRPORT: We arrived early into the airport and had arranged with the hotel for a car to pick us up. The driver was waiting for us. His car (E series Mercedes) was very clean. He was very professional and took the time to show us some of Rome on our way to the hotel. The cost was reasonable at $55 Euro(about $71.5 USD). I considered it reasonable as I spend that much from San Francisco airport to the financial district of San Francisco so the cost was inline with large cities. HOTEL: When we arrived at the hotel our room was ready and this was at approximately 9:00 a.m. We were greeted by Fabrizio. He was very nice and quite helpful (more on him later).We went up to our room on the first floor. The room was small (although we booked a deluxe room). However, the linens were fabulous on the bed. The comforter was absolutely clean. The room itself was very clean. The closet was cedar and had a wonderful fragrance. The a/c worked (almost too well).We did have a window that opened to the street. It was nice to open it when we stopped by in the afternoon. The bathroom was nice even though it was small as well but pretty clean. In other words, this was a typical non chain European hotel. The only thing I would say is an area of opportunity is to regrout the around the tub and change the shower curtain. One day the maid did forget to leave face towels, but that wasn't a big deal. Yes, the TV is a 13" TV, but how much time does one really spend in the room. Afterall, there is something to do in Rome all day and most of the night. We had no problem sleeping at night. Yes the beds were hard (another European quality) but we slept quite well both nights. CUSTOMER SERVICE: Fabrizio is the best! He helped us in getting tickets to the Vatican Museum. He printed the tickets out for us and then gave us directions. When we returned hours later, he was still there with recommendatons for a late lunch. The restaurant was quite good even though it was on the tad expensive side. I had the lasagna and my husband had spaghetti with prawns, along with several other courses. Fabrizio's customer service was impeccable. He was friendly and did his very best to communicate with us in English. And I must say he did a great job! I communicated with the hotel for weeks to get information. He and the rest of the staff were prompt in answering emails. Fabrizio even told us how to get different places using the subway and bus. He drew routes on the maps, helped arrange our tour and also gave us direction on how to buy tickets for our train ride to Venice. However, there is one thing that I thought was the epitome of good customer service and that is he took the time to tell us where not to go so that we wouldn't be hassled by gypsies and pick pockets. His concern was very admirable. He made our trip to Rome very pleasant and tolerated my very bad attempts at speaking Italian. For all he did for us we want to say "Grazie". LOCATION: This hotel is perfectly situated to visit the Vatican (5-7 minute walk). If you want to go anywhere else you will need to take the bus, or the subway or walk some pretty good distances. I wasn't up for the walking as the heat was in the high 80s when we were there. ROOF TOP & FOOD Yes you can see the dome of St. Peters from the roof top. We went up tto the roof top each morning we were there. They had an assortment of cold cereal, fruit (very good fruit), yogart, juices, bread, coffee, and pastries. To be honest, I really didn't like the eggs as they were not well done and I don't eat eggs unless they are cooked completely. The bacon also wasn't cooked as well as I like . BOTTOM LINE: If you go to this hotel expecting it to be like a Marriott, Courtyard Marriott, Holiday Inn, or any of those chains, then you are going to be sadly disappointed. However, if you are looking for a charming "real" Italian hotel, with good customer service, located near the Vatican, then by all means check out the Hotel Dei Consoli. I am glad we did. BTW....Just so you are not as shocked as we were since this was our first time in Europe. When you are taken to uour room, you will have to put the key in the slot insde the room in order for the electricty to work. VERY COOL! No wasting of electricity!

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel through Expedia...the room has no A/C”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel021961
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel room through Expedia...it was a Deluxe Superior room and specifically said it had air conditioning. When we arrived, we went to our room and it was not airconditioned and very hot. We went down to the front desk and they came up to the room and said....but can't you hear the air conditioner. Sure there was a small amount of air blowing into the room but it was not air conditioned...it was warm air. They insisted it was the A/C and said the only thing they could do was offer us an upgrade at our cost. So we paid 25 additional euros a night for a slightly larger room but it had A/C. They told us the original room was their expedia room. We had to wonder if they sell the expedia room and then use it as a means to get people to upgrade. The front desk staff don't speak much english and are not all that friendly. Other than that, the hotel is very small but is well taken care of. The breakfast room on the roof is very nice. Its location is perfect for visiting the Vatican and the Pizza Navona etc. We stayed here for two days and then moved to another hotel in Rome for another four days. We will not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Noisy Roof!”
Reviews.Author: TravelTurtle66
Reviews.Content: Be forewarned! This hotel has a major problem. Our room was on the 3rd floor which is the floor below the rooftop dining area. The dining area has a stone tile floor that is actually a floating type of floor. It rests on plastic mounts. It is not very stable and the tiles fit together rather loosely. While we were up there we noticed a worker trying to level off the floor (as the tiles fit together a bit unevenly) by plucking up two tiles and adjusting the height of the support. Later when we were in our room I kept hearing a loud low rumbling noise that came from above. It was loud enough and constant enough that it was very hard to sleep through and went on until well after midnight. I remembered the worker adjusting the flooring and realized that it was the sound the heavy stone floor tiles made as they shifted slightly when people walked on them. If you stay here and stay on the 3rd floor (there are only three with rooms) you are likely to have this problem. Beware! If you come in from the U.S. and are tired and go to sleep on the early side, you will not sleep well. Otherwise hotel is pleasant and well located, but I would not stay here again as the odds are high you will get a 3rd floor room. If you bring a laptop be advised that the internet charge is a steep 15 euros a day. Staff was friendly. Rooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Kate_Swaffer
Reviews.Content: The pictures lie about the hotel - is is not at all like what the pictures suggest.. The room was pokey, the 'double' bed was two single beds pushed together - not even sheeted as a double bed. The TV was smaller than our laptop. The bar for drinks in the evening was average - many of the drinks on the menu were not available although the waiter was very pleasant. The breakfast was good on the first day and a pleasant waiter, but dreadful on the second day - cold scrambled eggs and grumpy waiter. Overall, it detracted from our stay in Rome and we would not recommend it to anyone. Some staff helpful, others unpleasant as if they wished you weren't there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: oscmj
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, very close to St. Peter's Basillica/Vatican. Very clean with very nice staff who was always willing to help. The breakfast was a plus with a great atmosphere on the rooftop terrace, excellent coffee/cappucino with super service. We were given our choice of two different rooms, opting for the corner room with a bit more space. The bathroom area is tight especially the shower but excellent water pressure and luxury bath towels made you forget about the tight space. The location made for easy access to shopping, Vatican, Metro (subway), buses, Gelateria. Booked thru Expedia (AARP) using the shuttle service from/to the airport which was excellent and on time. I would recommend Hotel Dei Consoli to anyone coming to Rome looking for a great place stay. Thank you (staff) all for an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “great position, very clean, felt like home”
Reviews.Author: lucyswine
Reviews.Content: My husband & I met friends in Rome at the Hotel Consoli and would recommend it to anyone - but please don't tell the world as we felt we'd discovered a gem! So close to the Vatican down tree-lined streets. When we walked back from the Via Condotti, the Spanish Steps etc we felt like locals returning home. Beautiful, small rooms, very clean bathrooms and rooftop terrace breakfasts and the wonderful Fabrizio made our stay so memorable. Can't wait to return and do it all again!

Reviews.Title: “An excellant hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: johnmariaandemily
Reviews.Content: After a long week travelling around Italy we arrived at the hotel very tired. The concierge Fabrizio was very friendly and sorted out a little booking problem with our dates and our flights home. The rooms where clean and comfortable and nicely cooled. Situated very close to the Vatican city and museums(less than 5 min walk) and from there you can get either a tour bus,public bus or metro to get to the other sights. We decided to walk and was surprised to find that all the major attractions are within 10 minutes of each other(bring good walking shoes as my feet were sore after) The breakfast on the roof was a nice edition and a good variety of food to keep you going till lunch.Plenty of good restraunts and shops nearby to spoil any traveller. Thank you for making my time in Rome that bit more special.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: napinsurrey
Reviews.Content: Amazing to go up to the terrace & see the dome of St Peters. The staff were courteous, The rooms were clean & more than adequate. Close to public transport. With a wide variety of restaurants, from inexpensive to expensive, all in walking distance. It was my wifes birthday & the hotel organised a bottle of Italian bubbly on the roof terrace. I would like to thank them for organising this. Nev & Pat Bagley (Normandy Surrey)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel would recommend to everyone”
Reviews.Author: Chrissmith85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in August 2010 and all i have to say is about this hotel is fantasic things. I would recommend this to everyone i know. The hotel arranged a taxi to pick us up from the airport this saved me time and money. On arrival to the hotel i was greeted by the friendly and helpful receptionists that checked us in to our room,. They gave us a free map and spoke to us about the location, things to see and the history. Any thing i needed the staff was always happy to help 24/7. The breakfast in the morning was excellent a wide range of food to choose from and the food was lovely. With a freshly made coffee or cappacino with the views you cannot beat it. The attention to detail and level of customer service was best i have ever had. I used the internet everyday and had no problems. If you do not like the hotel there is something wrong with you. This location is the best you can walk to every site very easy. I have stayed at many hotels and this is the best hotel i have ever stayed at i would say a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, would recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: Cenveo
Reviews.Content: we stayed for a week touring rome, loved this hotel. the rooftop breakfast area was perfect for breakfast and a after dinner drink at the end of a busy day. great location near the Vatican. One of the better hotels we stayed at during our trip to Italy this year. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near Vatican”
Reviews.Author: JAC5280
Reviews.Content: PROS: Within walking distance to Vatican, comfy room CONS: Staff is a bit unfriendly, you leave key at the front desk as you leave

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating Experience”
Reviews.Author: amschitaly
Reviews.Content: While I agree that the upstairs patio is lovely for breakfast, and some of the staff are very helpful, if you are someone that needs INTERNET, do not stay at this hotel. It was a nightmare. There were often a cluster of guests sitting near their one computer and internet zone, frustrated at the lack of wifi service. We even tried switching rooms to no avail. I had work committments and will always check in the future because this was a problem throughout Italy. I found the staff to vary greatly in helpfullness at the front desk. We had good days and bad. Although close to the Vatican, I would stay on the other side of the River next time to walk around more. I do recommend the nearby tour buses but make sure to buy for 48 hours if you are there long enough. Saves you a lot of hassle getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MiniMan64
Reviews.Content: Just a fantastic place to stay in Rome! My partner organised this for us as a four day stay to see the city and she choose well. Although you will not be in what is considered the "centre of Rome" the Vatican is within 5 minutes walk, the Metro (bargain!) is within 10 minute walk and will take you anywhere you need to go and there are lots of shops and bars near by and it's actually quite nice to be in a quieter spot. We a lovely time here, very good service, beautiful breakfast on the roof and we would defintely come back again. The only tiny negative I could come up with is the rooms are little small BUT they have everything you need, very comfortable beds, large showers and to be honest, if you are in Rome and spending that much time in your room, YOU'RE DOING IT WRONG! PS. Advice to anyone in Rome for three or more days: Buy a Roma Pass for €25, you get unlimited travel on the Metro (you'll need it!) and free entry and queue jumping at the Coloseum (plus one other venue) which is a total must

Reviews.Title: “Charming Service in Lively Area”
Reviews.Author: RoryMont
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant small hotel in a lively area close to the Vatican but just off the tourist beaten track. The staff are charming and helpful. Our room was small but adequate, and well maintained (the very small television could however be upgraded, I feel). The breakfast buffet, served on the well-appointed rooftop terrace (which also had a big screen for the World Cup, an excellent and much appreciated touch) is fairly standard. Internet access is charged at €2.95 per hour, and there is no printer (though it was possible to send our boarding passes to reception to print out). We would warmly recommend the restaurant Dal Toscano on Via Germanico, and the Cafe Portofino down towards the other end of the Via Cola di Rienzo.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, best breakfast, outstanding service, close to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Beachlover5169
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 2 teenagers July/10. Fabrizio was wonderful, took care of a booking issue that was rather complicated, and all with a warm smile. Fabrizio went above and beyond to ensure our stay there was as pleasant as possible, and was always so patient with giving us directions, recommending restaurants, sights, bus and metro information. The hotel is beautiful, rooms were opulant, not too small, we had a computer available on our floor, along with a reading area. The breakfast had a good variety of hot and cold food to choose from. Breakfast was servied on the beautiful rooftop (4th floor) terrace. Easy 10 min walk to the Vatican, bus stop around the corner, 6 min. walk to the Metro. Good shopping area. Can easily reach Spanish Steps/Trevi Fountain/Coloseum from bus you catch just around the corner, or from Metro. Nice safe neighbourhood, quiet. We would book this hotel again. Thank You Fabrizio!!!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: roseylee54
Reviews.Content: this is a very nice hotel near the vatican city and most of the other sites of interest are close by. Not far from the hotel is a bus stop for a city tour ,it costs 18 euro's for 2 days you can get on and off as much as you like it is a great way of getting to all parts. if you are going to the coouseum and the forum ,go to the forum first and you will have a ticket for both cheaper. Best meals we had was at the Hard Rock cafe good servis as well. The hotel staff was all very polite and pleasant,the breakfast waiter was always pleasant and helpful in all a very good holiday was had by us all, rooms were very clean and a good size bedroom and bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Wont get a better hotel and location in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Bigneebs
Reviews.Content: Just back after five fantastic days in Rome. The hotel was excellent. Spotlessly clean, excellent friendly staff. Located five minutes from the Vatican city walls. The icing on the cake was the roof top terrace over looking St Peters Basilica. Breakfast alfresco in the morning and finish of the day with a bottle of wine on the roof for only 15 Euros. Within a ten minute wak there is a subway station and St Peters square where you can catch all the city tour buses. Drew and Catherine. Kirkcaldy Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectation”
Reviews.Author: CleeveBattle_UK
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel particularly in respect of service. Everyone was surprisingly pleasant and went out of their way to be really helpful. The location was superb, within walking distance of everywhere we wanted to visit. The en-suite was not over large but for four days, not a problem. We would recommend the hotel highly and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Great Location - Staff and Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Puddles90
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights with our friends, and loved the location, the friendly staff and the Roof Garden. Would recommend highly to anybody wishing to go Rome who wishes to be within walking distance of the Vatican and excellent shops and Restuarants.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC-It was wonderful.......”
Reviews.Author: Captrld
Reviews.Content: When you travel abroad you want to make sure you get in a hotel that is right. It can make or break a vacation. Every aspect of the dei Consoli was great. The room is comfortable and elegant, room service is great, hotel location is perfect, the breakfast was outstanding , the hotel is decorated very tastefully throughout with great first and fourth floor for the breaksfast buffet, and the service from all at the hotel is fabulous. Always happy to help you in everyway, and very professional. Always a feeling of elegance. We really felt like we were in Rome. Myt first time there and I am so glad that I picked the Consoli, and when I return to Rome I know I will be staying there. We were there for nine days. Bobby and Gloria D'Angelo

Reviews.Title: “very helpfull/pleasent staff, good to visit Vatican etc. Near metro”
Reviews.Author: englandgirl_9
Reviews.Content: room was smaller than expected, but clean, & comfortable bed, larger than king size bed. Bathroom not big but good size shower. Despite double glazing, the road outside was noisy on Saturday eve, but not too bad after that. Breakfast served on 1st floor was good, cereals, fruit, yoghurt, cakes, pastries, scrambled egg & bacon. waiter makes you coffee if you want a capacino, or serve yourself. Very nice terrace with view of Vatican on one side. whole view of Vatican blocked a bit by buildings. All said, had a good stay, very handy for Vatican, nearby metro(about 10min walk) Not really a 4star, but they are very helpfull. Oh, NO tea/coffee facilities in room. plenty of restaurants around to walk out to in the evening, depending on how far you want to walk, some within 5-10min, etc

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisagmd
Reviews.Content: Just left the Hotel dei Consoli a few days ago - GREAT place to stay! Found the front desk staff (especially Luca) very helpful - from asking about taxi rates to the stazione (way easier than lugging baggage up and down steps in the metro) to finding an electronics store when I realized I had left my cable for the camera at home. DOH! The room was quite small - but the bathroom was HUGE - and beautiful. Much nicer than my bath at home with a shower, nice big vanity and a bidet. The breakfast is very good - with eggs, yogurt and fresh fruit and a huge variety of pastries - and their cappucino is fabulous. The day I arrived, Fausto even left the breakfast open for me beyond the usual hours so that I could get a bite to eat and a good coffee. The location is great - 10 min walk to the metro and 5 min to St. Peter's Square. There is also really great shopping just to the east of the hotel. Buses 19, 32 and 81 all go toward Pia. Venezia and stop right near the hotel on hte way back. Since the metro service is limited - I found it tough to get bus information until after I arrived. To find the hotel from the metro (Ottaviano) - exit toward Via Ottaviano and then turn left. Walk down to the Square (Risorgimiento) and turn left again. Via Varrone is off of this street - about 1 block up. Make note of this - because Via Varrone is very small and not located on many tourist maps. I had a helluva time finding the place on my first try. One restaurant you cannot miss is one block from the Ottaviano metro on Via degli Scipioni, 50 - called "Da Vito e Dina." Vito is a trip - not much English from him (or his wife Dina) but the food is outstanding - and very inexpensive. I would absolutely come back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Consoli still our favorite hotel in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: thosetwo
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Consoli six times, and have never had a complaint about anything. It's comfortable (nice firm beds and pillows), clean, and well-situated (we walk to everything), the staff is always friendly and helpful. They provide a nice breakfast, especially Fausto's excellent capuccino. There are other lovely hotels in Rome, but we're happy to return to the Consoli every year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bovril17
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay at the Hotel Dei Consoli. We chose this hotel specifically for its close location to The Vatican/St. Peter's Square. It is immaculate throughout and our room was perfectly adequate for our requirements. It wasn't the biggest hotel bedroom we have ever had but with a very comfy bed, plenty of hot water and our own fridge (which would be a god send in the summer months) we were very happy. All it lacked was a kettle...typical Brits! Even though the weather was quite mild for February the heating in the hotel was on full blast and the room could get quite stuffy during the night. Opening the window to let in some air did unfortunately also let in the street noise which was pretty much 24hours a day. We were both impressed with the choice at breakfast and managed to fill up sufficiently before a full day of sight seeing. The majority of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. The hotel is just off a main shopping street with plenty of cafes and restaurants in the vicinity and in close proximity to the hop-on/hop-off bus stops. So an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, WONDERFUL SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: bridalsweet
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from a 7 night stay in Rome. We are 2 women travelers and the staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating. They helped us with directions, dining recommendations, anything else we needed. The room was nice, decent bathroom. Delicious breakfast buffet served. Great location, close to the Metro. I am planning a return trip there with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the Road”
Reviews.Author: zeebraaman
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel if great. Right by the vatican. However the staff was somewhat surly. Also they recommeded a resturant that was terrible La Barca. Who has many very bad reviews on this site. They should reconsider the recommendations they are making. --- The room was somewhat clean although the maid never vacumed the floor. -- Faustis, I know I am saying his name wrong, who is the breakfast service is great and is very helpful, more so then the desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: paripatetic
Reviews.Content: What lovely people at Hotel Dei Consoli. We arrived for a few days in Rome with our Mum who is in a wheelchair. The Hotel is very small, and we had to enter via a courtyard to access the lift, the hotel staff were wonderful. The rooms are very very small, but comfortable. When we were trying to make the room work for us and accommodate the wheelchair, the porter was great - take out a table, take the door off the bathroom - No Problem - done in a flash! The hotel has no restaurant which is a bit of a shame, but the restaurant accross the road were great, and we took the food onto the roof terrace which was lovely. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. Wheelchairs are a bit of a challenge, but we managed due to the kindness, care and attention of the staff. The location is wonderful. We could walk to the Vatican which minimised transportation issues. We found a great handicapped taxi service which I will post on the general Rome site, which made life a lot easier. The roof terrace is lovely and we took our pizza and wine there in the evening and enjoyed watching the sun go down over the etrnall city - bliss.

Reviews.Title: “Delightfull, clean and convenient location for a lovely stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: CMBD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a stay in this hotel and I can say we were both very happy with our choice of accomodation. We stayed here following a week long cruise of the med and were delighted to see that everything was as detailed in hotel information. What really surprised us was how near we were to the Vatican. literally just 'round the corner'. There were plenty of restaurants to choose from and plenty of historical sites to visit all within walking distance. The Bus Tours main stop at St. Peter's Square is also very close for those who prefer to see the city from a height, it's well worth taking a trip on these as it gives an overall view of most of the popular historical sites. Our room, although small, was all we needed to rest after a days sightseeing in this wonderfull city. I liked the decor of the hotel and found the male receptionist on our arrival very helpfull. We were also able to check into our room very early which was a bonus. I especially liked the idea of having breakfast on the roof terrace and the gentleman who served us was very efficient and polite although he had very little english! All in all a lovely small, quaint hotel and we will be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: Waikikinokaoi
Reviews.Content: I am surprised by reading the reviews on this hotel. I stayed there for three nights and was not impressed by the reception staff. They were all men and did not offer us any assistance. Each time we asked for something we felt like we were being a bother and they had better things to do. Some of them wouldn't even take their eyes off the computer while we spoke to them. That kind of service is not acceptable to me. Our room was tiny. It barely fit two small twin beds. The bathroom only had a shower stall and it was barely big enough to take a shower in. Every time I turned around in the shower my arm would hit the water spout and the the water would turn cold. The carpet on the steps needs to be replaced. The breakfast food was okay but nothing to brag about. The scrambled eggs were horrible and the hard boiled eggs were way over cooked. Many of the utensils and plates had dried food on them. The only thing that saved this hotel was the location, the Filipino porter, and the gentleman that handled the breakfast terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Brilliant Location with very helpful staff!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lolapatty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned after an exhausting 5 day city break in the Eternal City. This hotel was one of the highlights of our trip. It was so lovely to return to such a special environment after our days out sightseeing all Rome has to offer. On arrival our room was upgraded to a junior suite which was a pleasant surprise. The hotel is quiet, romantic, in a brilliant location near to the Vatican and to the local network of buses and metro which will take you anywhere you want to go. The concierge was extremely helpful and polite, we even checked into our room three hours early which is usually not the case with most hotels, but was no problem here. The breakfast on the terrace was wonderful, the hotel was spotless, all in all we had a splendid stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: irishbluebird
Reviews.Content: My wife, sister and law, her husband, their three year old son and I have just returned from a most enjoyable stay at the Hotel Dei Consoli. This is a boutique hotel with a small reception. The rest of the hotel is first class with beautiful rooms, linen and towels changed every day and superb air conditioning; ideal to cool down from the heat of Rome. Breakfast is served on the roof patio where there are excellent views of the city. The position of the hotel is ideal for visiting the Vatican which is just around the corner and the reception staff were very helpful in providing a map for visiting the rest of the city. I emailed the hotel in advance and they sent a minivan to pick us up and take us back to the airport at 65 euro each way which was cheaper the most operators and excellent value bearing in mind there were 5 in our party. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome and although this was our first visit we intend to return and we will definitely stay the the Consoli.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, 'bijou' hotel in an excellent position for sightseeing in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: KeenTouristEssexUK
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in this lovely hotel, which is within minutes of the Vatican and St Peter's Square. The roof terrace is a great feature and it was wonderful to enjoy a good breakfast and to see the dome of St Peter's across the roof tops. The staff were all pleasant and we found the receptionist particularly personable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly beautiful, wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MIss_KM121
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, fantastic location, exeptionally helpful, friendly and polite staff. Food was wonderful, as was room. Exceptional value for money and best hotel I have ever stayed in!If you want a hidden gem of a hotel, just by the Vatican, with luxurious rooms and prosfessional, helpful staff, then book a room or suite at 'Hotel Dei Consoli'!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Hotel near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: rlvtanner
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Europe as a surprise for her birthday. We stayed 3 nights at this hotel as we wanted to be near the Vatican where most of our scheduled activities we located. My wife truly fell in love with the hotel. It is quaint and certainly boutique by American standards but the rooms are a good size and the fit and finish of the hotel gives it a high-end feeling. The bathrooms provide more room than most comparable hotels and the location for anyone wanting to be closer to the Vatican than not can not be beat. The service was outstanding and the terrace breakfast was excellent and provides something for both American and European pallets. We certainly plan to return to Rome and we will stay again at Hotel Dei Consoli.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Staff, and Location”
Reviews.Author: Ter-bud
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were booked into the Amalia Hotel, but for some reason were transferred to its "sister hotel" Hotel dei Consoli. We could not have been happier. On our early arrival, the front desk staff was very polite, offering to take our bags and suggesting a restaurant to visit. Our room on the first floor was spacious. With all the reviews on European hotel rooms being small, I had been a bit concerned. Our room had a large bed, plenty of room to get around, a jacuzzi tub with shower, at least 12 foot ceilings, french doors to a small balcony, etc. The bed was very comforable and we slept great. Rooms were very quiet. We'd often spend some time there in the afternoon cooling down and making plans for the rest of the day. Breakfast was very good -- a nice, small buffet with cold fruits and danishes, hot eggs and ham, juice, breads, milk, coffee, expresso, etc. Location was great. We were steps from the Vatican, restaurants, bus stops, metro stop, and gelato shops. It was quiet in the evenings, and a great place to head out to all the sites. The personnel were very polite and helpful. We really appreciated the front desk staff. They provided us with maps, directions, bus schedules, metro information, restaurant suggestions, info on tipping, etc. When we return to Rome, and we will be back, we will stay at the Hotel dei Consoli again. The best way I can sum up my experience is this: I've never left a review for a hotel before (although I often send notes to the hotel if I've had a good experience), but we were so happy with Hotel dei Consoli that I wanted to put this out as an additional Thank You to the hotel and it's staff.

Reviews.Title: “Between average and very good”
Reviews.Author: dubainick
Reviews.Content: Would prefer to have a further rating of good for this hotel - but not available. For me the pros and cons are as follows: Pros - double glazing. Last time I stayed in Rome I went for a cheap pension near Spanish Steps where noise from cobbled streets and scooters made sleep impossible. Double glazing as others have noted is very good in this hotel. We were on the corner and with windows shut, noise was minimal. Location - Vatican side I think gets you better value. Nearby buses and Metro make everything easy to get to. This is also more a middle class Italian area with lots of restaurants all busy with Italians and little risk of tourist rip offs together with good middle of the road shopping - go to Spansih steps for the upmarket. Room decor - as per web site. Not my taste particularly, but quite well done. Room size OK for Rome. Cons - sells itself as business friendly. I had problems with my computer which they could not assist with at all - I found out it is was my IT dept fault, but their lack of knowledge was obvious. They had an available hotel lap top but the internet speed was totally pathetic - fine for 10 years ago but not for today. Bathroom -shower head sprayed everywhere as the seal had gone. Breakfast - friendly service, but middle of the road Mediterranean breakfast served -i.e ordinary. 3 star Italian hotels in my view have very ordinary breakkfasts. Service - a bit begrudging for the most part from front desk. Overall, I was happy enough to stay there, but would not go back again. Prices off season were OK, but I think Rome prices in peak season make it a poor value city at that time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: darubes
Reviews.Content: If you want to be by the Vatican and not spend a fortune this is the place. It is a 5-10 minute walk to the Vatican and a 5-10 minute walk to the Metro (subway). For 2.5 euros you can go to the Colosseum,Trevi Fountain, etc. in less than 15 minutes on the Metro. The hotel is very clean and the staff is very friendly. The staff recommended some great restaurants to us once again within a 5 minute walk. The area has LOTS of shopping. There appears to be very little night-life in the area but again we were not really interested in that.Like all European hotels the rooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel And Comfortable Oasis...”
Reviews.Author: BucknB2
