Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 9 days (June 30 - July 8) and was immediately impressed with the location and cleanliness. Yes, my room was very small, but exceptionally clean and comfortable. It was very hot and oppressively humid and the air-conditioned room was a welcome respite. The breakfast on the roof each morning was very good quality and has a nice selection for every taste. The service staff is the best! Every request was handled courteously and efficiently. Even though a busy street fronts one side of this hotel, with dual-pane windows, it was very peaceful. So, would I recommend this hotel? Absolutely! The location is so convenient to the Vatican, transportation and restaurants. However, I would add some suggestions. First, if you are a family of 3 or more, you will be cramped. I'd say couples and singles will love it here. The only other thing would be to pass on the hotel supplied refrigerator supplies!! €5 for a can of Coke, you can get down the street at Coin for €.95, is outrageous!! I would not hesitate an instant to book a stay here...

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: UncleUnky
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dei Consoli was a very clean and quiet place to stay in Rome. It is a short walk to the Vatican or a subway stop. The breakfast was good in a very nice setting on the roof top with potted citrus trees. The concierge, Luca Loprete, was extremely helpful. When we asked for extra pillows, they were at our door in 15 minutes. He gave us very helpful directions in getting to our destinations around Rome. Rooms are not spacious but that is normal in Europe. Beds and bathrooms were spotless. I didn't hear noises from outside or other guests--a big plus for me.

Reviews.Title: “it's okay”
Reviews.Author: daleeper
Reviews.Content: I booked this through Hotels.com and was told that I could cancel my reservations up to the day before my date of arrival. Then it turned out the representative of Hotels.com mislead me and it was not cancellable so I was stuck. First lesson learned! Most of the trip advisor reveiws mentioned that the hotel is clean and yes I have to agree. I also have to agree the bed was super hard. There were also strange noises late at night that would wake me up that sounded like house cleaning was going to town vacuuming or running different machines such as dryers that timed out and buzzing would go off. When I contacted the front desk they said they didn't know where the noises were coming from. It was pretty miserable trying to sleep through the night here. The location was good if you are primarily going to the Vatican but other than that it doesn't seem to be the most charming area of Rome so I would pick another area if I go back. The breakfast was nice because you are up on the garden roof top and the gentleman that ran it was nice. The food was okay. I stayed at another 4 star hotel in Florence and their breakfast was so much better that the food here wasn't quite so good. This was just okay so I would not stay here again or really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “good location if you have to be near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: anilegna
Reviews.Content: there were 3 of us at this hotel and we had to stay near the Vatican, the rooms were small especially since we wanted to save money and had three twin beds in one room, 3 of us for two nights was euro210 per room, my mom stayed an extra night by herself for a cheaper price we couldn't figure out the aircon (and couldn't be bothered to complain) so we slept with the window opened, a bit of street noise but not too bad, the Vatican area at night is dead with basically not much to eat/see or do but the walk over to ie the Navona area takes only about 15 min breakfast was included in the room price and was decent, location is good if you have to be near the Vatican, Rome/Vatican is kind of an annual event now for my family so will likely come back to this hotel again, but if I was in Rome by myself, I'd much rather stay around the Navona or Trastevere side

Reviews.Title: “Intimate Hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: pavgupta00
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and location. Our overriding wish was to have a hotel near the Vatican and reasonably close to the subway. We also wanted a clean, neat hotel with a couple amenities. This hotel fit the bill. Cleanliness & Service: No complaints. The room was always well kept, and clean by the time we returned from daily sightseeing in the late afternoon, prior to leaving for dinner. The cleaning staff was quiet, courteous and barely seen. Breakfast was very good; a nice spread of fruit, pastries, breakfast meats, cereals and, of course, coffee. Staff was helpful in providing touring suggestions, arranging a taxi for our trip to the airport and arranging dinner reservations. Location: Very nice. A little bit of a walk from the subway (~5-10 minutes) but shopping and a couple reasonable restaurants nearby, and great access to the Vatican and Vatican Museum. We are both in our late-20s, and for a couple who likes to walk, it was fine for even exploring "downtown" Rome. Taxis are also easily available from nearby taxi stands. On the otherhand, if you are looking to party late into the night in Rome, and then stumble back to this hotel, I might think twice. The streets can be pretty deserted after 11PM. Probably safe, but can be a little eerie. Room: Somewhat on the small side, for those used to US hotel rooms, but probably similar to other Rome hotels. TV was small, and our room didn't offer much of a view. The bed was perfectly fine. If you plan on spending a great deal of time (other then sleeping) in your room, this may not be the best place to be. If you are looking for a comfortable bed and clean room, it's great. Value: Given the nice location, good breakfast and very helpful staff, I think the price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: FRANKIESheffield
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location. the rooms although a bit on the small side were very clean. The decor and attention to details of the room were faultless

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...”
Reviews.Author: AnneLancashire
Reviews.Content: Great hotel at reasonable price. Exceptionally clean and all the staff were very friendly indeed (and couldn't do enough for you)! Rooms are a little small but well laid out. Good location - plenty of small restaurants in the vicinity (turn right out of the hotel). Lots of good shopping on the doorstep. Unfortunately the roof terrace was not open at the time of our visit (opens for the season in a couple of weeks) - however we did go on the roof for a quick look around. Very pleasant indeed.

Reviews.Title: “The Friendliest and Best Staff in Rome”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller7678
Reviews.Content: Great Location! Near public transportation, Terrific Shopping Street, Lots of reasonably priced restaurants and the friendliest and most helpful English speaking staff of anywhere I've stayed. They couldn't do enough for us. Great breakfasts too! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and home away from home”
Reviews.Author: ClayClay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just completed a trip to Italy starting in Florence and ending in Rome at the Hotel dei Consoli. The Hotel was in a great location next to Vatican City and convenient to bus and train. Tremendous value for the money and the staff was terrific and most accommodating to all needs.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel close to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Cathkc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located for the Vatican. And there is a metro station close by for access to the rest of the city. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff were great. The breakfast was also excellent. Aa downside was the wifi was not working when we were there and the TV would not tune in properly. But only 2 minor things. The resturant across the road is worth a look. We had a lovely romantic break in Rome and the hotel played an integral part in making our trip great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diskdr
Reviews.Content: We were booked in the Hotel Altante Garden - and refused to stay in the room they allocated (the only one they had) - and were booked in this hotel for a night --- its is very clean great service and apart from the bed being a little hard -- nice. The roof top terrace breakfast was perfect. The restaurant opposite is great - try the mussels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Mousewife
Reviews.Content: At the upper limit of what I would deem "budget," the Hotel dei Consoli was a magnificent experience. A short walk to the Vatican; near countless restaurants; close to (Rome's notoriously substandard) public transportation; the Consoli is just about perfect. An obscure hole in the wall hotel, it nevertheless gives warm views in various directions, picturesque scenes of Roman life. The staff was consistently friendly and helpful, moreso than I find typical even of the generally genial Roman populace at large. The breakfast was above average for such venues. The room, while small, was comfortable, clean, and charming. Vast windows let in light and air if you wanted it, but great brocaded drapes kept it out if that was your preference. I warmly recommend the Consoli.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: specrobinson
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Rome before I was quite familiar with the area before booking Consoli. While there are tourists everywhere in Rome, this hotel was in an area which saw mostly locals. Having said that, a 1 minute walk brought you within a stones throw of the Vatican walls. The location was great. As with most hotels in Italy, especially big centers such as Rome, there were countless restaurants, cafes and bars close by. Starvation is virtually impossible here. If you choose to stay here, I highly recommend L'amatriciana restaurant which is one block away and a local favorite. Rooms were small, as with all hotels in Rome, but very clean. Breakfast was included and was very good by European standards. The front desk staff was always available to answer questions and make suggestions. I would stay here again without a doubt... very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: capetiv
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small, but very clean. The bathroom was very comfortable. The desk clerk was always great at getting cabs for us and he recommended very affordable places to eat. The rooftop terrace allows a peek at the basillica's dome and is staffed by a wonderful man. He made great coffee,breakfast and tour suggestions. Walk to the Vatican and an easy cab ride to other areas. We recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Rome Break”
Reviews.Author: JeffBKenilworth
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 day Romantic Rome break with my wife: a double celebration of our anniversary and her birthday. The hotel was first class: everywhere spotless, classy decor, very friendly staff (arranged a bouquet for my wife on arrival), rooms cleaned promptly/daily and roof terrace breakfast with views of Rome/Vatican very relaxing. Prices very reasonable. We did find the beds quite hard on your back so if like us you prefer medium or soft, better ask on first night! Overall verdict = superb, quiet hotel in handy location giving good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anagno100
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel - decent location near the vatican, and eiher walking distance to the centre or there is a bus from the nearby square direct - at only 1 euro per journey this is a reasonably priced way to get around. Luca is especially helpful and just very nice. he recommended a couple of restaurants - both expensive and a lovely local restaurant. The room - we upgraded to a deluxe room (309) and this seemed to be one of the most spacious rooms on our floor according to the floor plan provided (for fire regulations). The bathroom was very nice and everything was newly decorated. Air conditioning was always on when we returned to the room (not very eco friendly but defintely appreciated when returning from 34 degrees outside). There was a fridge and a safe. We would definitely stay here again if visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaPeach76
Reviews.Content: My grown daughters and I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Dei Consoli, Rome, Italy, July 3-7, 2008. This boutique hotel is a little gem! All of the staff (particularly Luca, our concierge) was extremely pleasant and helpful. The rooms were quiet and very clean, and the baths quite spacious with good counter space. Our daily breakfast was served on the rooftop restaurant. The presentation was beautiful and the food delicious. This hotel is within a short walking distance of Vatican City. There is a main street lined with shops and restaurants less than a block from the entrance of the hotel. A walk to the Spanish Steps and Via Veneto was easily doable from the hotel. Except for going out to dinner, we walked everywhere from this hotel. If I ever have the opportunity to return to Rome, I will plan to stay at this hotel again and I will refer it to fellow travelers to Rome. Sherry, Atlanta, Georgia

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: BeenThereLondon
Reviews.Content: Rome, Italy, Hotel Dei Consoli July 13-16, 2008 Absolutely Wonderful. My husband and I were there for our 25th Anniversary. Thank you to Laura and all the staff for making out stay so memorable. The breakfast on the terrace was very appetizing. Our room was upgraded and very beautiful and clean. All the staff were very helpful and pleasant. Thank you again. Rick and Sue (Canada) Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....HARD BEDS!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jweiss3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and extremely close to the Vatican. The people at the front desk are extremely helpful and pleasant. However, my husband and I had horrible back aches from the beds. It felt as though we were sleeping on concrete. The beds are SO hard so if you are not used to that....good luck! It actually made sleeping quite difficult. The breakfast they offer is decent although there is no variety and they serve the exact same thing everyday. Also, the rooms are extremely small and the bathrooms are even smaller. It would be impossible to fit 2 people in the bathrooms at the same time. If you are looking for a large room this is not the place for you. Lastly, on our second day they had to shut off the water and we had no access to a bathroom or shower for 24 hours. They had us use the restauraunt across the streets bathroom! It was ridiculous! The worst part of it was that they gave us NO discount on the room for putting us through that!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient Hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: shagswebber
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Dei Consoli for 6 nights to kick off our 5 week vacation around Europe. Looking back it was probably the best 4 star hotel we stayed in in Italy or France. The room wasn't overly large but it was clean, well presented and all that was required considering most of the day we were out exploring Rome. The location was on quite a funky street full of fashion shops and places to eat, about 10mins walk to St Peters Basilica and around 60 mins walk to the Colliseum. We ate each night at different Trattorias around the Hotel which we stumbled upon throughout our travels. The breakfast at the hotel was great: pastries, cold meats, cereals, toast, fruit and the waiter will make you whatever style coffee you want. It was so good I made a point of downing a couple every morning. Thoroughly recommend staying there if wanting a good value, well presented Hotel from which to explore Rome. We booked 4 months before arriving on expedia and got a great rate We will stay there when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Hotel dei Consoli very much!”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Sunshyn
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Hotel dei Consoli for two nights the first week of June and we enjoyed our stay very much. Luca at the Front Desk was wonderful and was ready with advice on restaurants or assistance with directions whenever we stopped to speak with him. The other Front Desk personnel were also courteous and ready to assist with whatever we needed. Our room was on the 2nd floor and while smaller than hotel rooms in the USA, they did make the most of the available space and the atmosphere was welcoming. The room and the bathroom were both very clean, and there was even a mini bar in the room, which had space available should you need to add a snack or drink of your own from the market next to the hotel. Television in the room was small and limited to only 2 English speaking channels. The breakfast was good. It had a nice variety of meats, yogurts, pastries, breads and fruits, along with scrambled eggs and juice. My favorite was the cappuccino! It was excellent. The server in the breakfast room was very friendly and helpful. There was also a laptop available on the 1st floor if you needed internet access. The charge for one hour was 2.95 euro and you had 3 months from your initial login to use the time. Please note, there was not a printer connected to the laptop. Overall we had a good stay at Hotel dei Consoli and we would stay there again if we go back to Rome. The only thing we would not do is have the hotel call a taxi for us. That was the only downside to our stay. The company they called both times we needed a taxi arrived with euro already on the meter. Evidently the meter starts when they accept the call from the Hotel. So save yourself some money and get the taxi on the street yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico”
Reviews.Author: madmicks
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, small rooms but all perfectly formed and exceptionally clean. Rooms cleaned daily and bed turned over by the time we got back. Breakfast was reasonable and a wonderful setting in the roof garden with lovely views. Best bit of all was the wonderful helpful staff who gave us so many ideas on how to make the most of our two nights and three days. Excellent hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “love Hotel de Consoli”
Reviews.Author: starshine82
Reviews.Content: The location was great, we felt very safe & secure here and the front desk was open all night.The staff was welcoming and very accomodating. The property is very comfortable & elegant right down to the heated towel bars in the bathroom. It is very convenient to the metro and so close to St Peter's that on the day we chose to visit my husband went ahead to stand on line while the rest of us had breakfast . We were inside the Vatican by 8:30- getting a huge jump on the "other tourists" due to a great location. And speaking of breakfast--it was open for service early at 7:30 am which we thought was great so we could get up and out early. The breakfast was a smorgasborg of delicious food- they provided an amazing variety. As Americans in Rome, we really enjoyed and appreciated the international assortment provided here especially the scrambled eggs and an Itailan version of bacon every day. Dont get me wrong I love the typical cappucino and pastry- but for health reasons I needed some "no carbs" to start the day. The internet service was very convenient- we purchsed the time, got the code and used it over the course of a few days, instead of having to buy the time use it up at one sitting. We stayed at Consoli for a few days then left for Tuscany. We realized that we packed way too much stuff to carry on the next leg of the journey and were returning to Consoli for the last night in Rome before departing for home and they allowed us to leave our excess luggage there, which was much appreciated. This was they best possible hotel for us in Rome. There was nothing not to love about it. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: bk2ca
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently while on a business trip to Rome. I took along a friend, so we needed a room with two twin beds. For the two of us the room was way too small. It was well appointed.The room was stuffy, and we needed fresh air, but the only way to get air was to open the window which was on the street and very noisy, because they do not turn on the AC until May or June. For the most part the staff was accomodating and not too friendly, but Luca, was a STAR! He should teach the others the true meaning of providing customer service!!! He suggested many good restaurants within walking distance to make sure we had some great meals. The breakfast was typical for Italy, and sufficient. There are no common areas for having a drink or relaxing, but they seem to be working on the rooftop area to make it a lounge of some sort. The location was perfect for the Vatican and catching the Hop on Bus if interested. I would stay their again only if I could be in a bigger room or if I was alone. The room was spotlessly clean!

Reviews.Title: “Well furnished but a little too claustrophobic for us.”
Reviews.Author: wickedstepmother
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the Dei Consoli is not an ideal hotel for tourists. There are no public rooms to relax in say, for a drink before dinner. The only public room is a small breakfast area. The breakfast was not good. The hot food was scrambled egg and a type of wafer thin ham but although it was in a warming dish was quite tepid and unappetizing. Lots of cakes and cold meat if you like that sort of thing for breakfast. The rooms we had were only big enough for a single bed but they put double beds in so just enough room to walk around. The bathroom door just managed to open without hitting the sink and the shower was hidden away behind the door. Don't ask the reception for advice on where to eat. We did this the first night and were sent to a local restaurant and the standard of the food was abysmal but it cost more than the average. Half way through the meal we were asked if we were from the Dei Consoli, so it seemed to us that they got commission for sending us there. However, Rome itself was beautiful. If we went again we'd try to get somewhere to stay in the Travastere area, lots of restaurants to choose from and more in the centre of the sightseeing than the Vatican end where the Dei Consoli was. Take good walking shoes; the cobbled streets are murder on the feet.

Reviews.Title: “best spot to stay near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Travelingexpats
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the Easter break. We had booked the junior suite for the four of us (2 adults and 2 kids)and they gave us another room in addition to the junior suite. The rooms are very small, but they are elegant. The breakfast was good; and,yes, the cappucino is great ! The hotel is very clean and well-appointed. This is a great location. In spite of the terrible rain for Easter and the days thereafter, we managed to walk everywhere. The location is lovely- nice shops and good eateries. We ate at the place across the street from the hotel a few times. It's called "Zigaetana" and it has good pizza, pasta, etc. The best thing about this hotel is the proximity to the Vatican. Seeing St. Peter's was the highlight of our trip!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: canning
Reviews.Content: I start with an apology to Fabritzio for taking so long to write this review of his wonderful hotel. My wife Gill and I stayed here for four nights in the second week of January. We had glorious weather and did all the sights on foot from the hotel. Thanks to Fabritzio we even managed to visit some of the wonderful places he pointed out to us on the map. The hotel is small, but was one of the cleanest and tidiest hotels I have ever stayed in, and I have been around a bit. Fresh towels and linen on a daily basis, now you don't get that at many places nowadays. There are a large number of Bars and Restaurants in the area, but most are very expensive (Compared to UK). However thanks again to Fabulous Fabritzio we found a great bar in the next street, with live music every night. Beatles tribute band were 'Fab' And with me being a Scot, I was even further amazed by Fabritzio, who it turns out plays the 'Bagpipes', and if you ask him nicely he will show a photograph of him in his Highland Outfit. I would also like to thank Foustus for his excellent service, and impeccable manners at Breakfast. He is also very knowledgeable and will help in whatever way he can. In fact all of the staff were very pleasant and helpful. And that includes the friendly Porter. All in all a definite must for me to return to. Full marks to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: WorkaDay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dei Consoli for our four nights in Rome, November 7 through 11, 2007. Our room was spotlessly clean, quiet, and very comfortable. Staff was pleasant and helpful. The buffet breakfast was varied and plentiful, with gracious service -- and delicious cappuchino! The location is conveniently near the Ottaviano Metro stop, and within a brief walk to St. Peter's, the Vatican Museums, and Castel St. Angelo. This made for great touring - - the longest lines are at St. Peter's and the Vatican Museums, but being so close meant we could enjoy a lovely breakfast, and still be first on line! The area is well served by the bus system also, so we found our way around all of Rome quite easily! The hotel is located in a pricey, upscale neighborhood which may not be the best for shopping, but felt safe at all hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Vatican area”
Reviews.Author: recurfizz
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in Vatican area of Rome. The frontdesk were reasonably helpful. Breakfast was very good, with a large selection to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: JANDASouthWales
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Dei Consoli. The rooms were not huge but spotlessly clean and well sound proofed. The only disappointment was the fact there were no tea and coffee making facilities which you would expect for a 4 star Hotel. Staff were pleasant and helpful. We were able to leave our luggage at the Hotel after checking out and could use the rooftop terrace and toilet facilities until our airport taxi (arranged by the Hotel and worth the 40 euro cost)picked us up. The location was great for St Peters and the Vatican but be prepared to queue-we waited over 2 hours to get into the Vatican. There is also a great indoor market just up the road selling fresh fruit and veg, pasta, wine, cheese etc. Breakfast good-bacon and eggs, ham,salami, cheese, bread, cereals,yoghurts, fruit etc and amazing croissants filled with custard! For eating out the best place is Trastevere which has a great atmosphere and plenty of choice.There is a taxi rank just around the corner from the Hotel and it cost us just 8 euros into Trastevere. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A real treat!”
Reviews.Author: hea27
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked the Hotel dei Consoli for my sisters first time in Rome/Italy. We had the choice of a 3 star near the Stazione Termini (cheaper of course), or here. We chose this hotel because it seemed quite luxurious and in a great location. We weren't disappointed. Me, having stayed in Rome two other times, really enjoyed this hotel. The last two times my boyfriend and I were on a budget, so we stayed near Stazione Termini. We were happy to pay more this time. I would recommend it to all of my family and friends. Yes, it wasn't cheap and our room was cosy (NOT small, just cosy), but if you don't want to stay near the train station or out on the skirts of the suburbs we've struggled to find a bargain. So, if you are finding the cost a little bit of a stretch but want to avoid the 'budget' experience, stay in a lovely location and enjoy excellent service - choose this hotel. If this hotel seems cheap to you and you are used to international 4 star hotels, you may find the breakfast a little dull but, you will love the location and surrounding excellent restaurants. Specifics: Rate: £147 / night, including breakfast. Location: excellent. On a teriffic shopping street and within 5 minutes walking distance to the Vatican Museum. Also a very pleasant walk to Plaza di Popolo, Plaza di Spagna, and then onto Via del Corso and Fontana di Trevi. €15 in a taxi to the Colosseo. Bus #81 from the main Plaza or near the hotel to Via dei Corso and Victor Emannuel Monument (then 5 minutes walking to Colosseo). Room: very clean, cosy, comfortable beds. No tea and coffee making. Bathroom: clean and comfortable. Shower only. Reception: very friendly and welcoming, also helpful recommending restaurants and bus routes. Breafast: average but enjoyable and filling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roma2007Rome
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Very quiet surroundings. Hotel staff very nice and rooms were great! Good selection for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JanetKen
Reviews.Content: Had a 4 night stay at Hotel Dei Consoli this August and had a great time. The weather was really hot, and coming back to our air conditioned room at the hotel was bliss. Yes, the room was small, but as we didn't spend much time in the room, it didn't really matter. We had a large comfy bed, and a really good shower. Our room was on the main road, but I can honestly say we ere never disturbed by any traffic noise. We found all the staff, but perticularly one of the gentlemen on reception very helpful. They kept our luggage for us ntil we were ready to go the airport at 2.00pm, and when we went bck to the hotel to pick up the luggage, they gave us access to a washroom, which was really good. All in all, a great short break, in a beautiful city staying at a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good location”
Reviews.Author: firefly67
Reviews.Content: A really good hotel for the price. The staff were excellent and the location was perfect for what we wanted to see. We were within walking distance of the Vatican/St. Peter's and there is a Metro station a five minute walk away and also a bus terminal nearby. The rooms are small, if you are travelling with a lot of luggage or plan on spending a lot of time in your room then this might not be the place for you but, you're in Rome, who wants to hang out in the hotel room! Breakfast was great and do order the cappuccino, one of the best we had.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel with the feel of Italia”
Reviews.Author: kimberleycaldwell
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i booked a last minute holiday to Rome at the end of Feb this year. we booked through a travel agent so we didnt know what to expect as it was such a rushed decision. the hotel was a little tucked away charm about some lovely shops. when you walk in, it isnt that impressive, but the staff take you up to your room and it really is lovely. the hotel upgraded us to the only room with a balcony, although very small this was a nice touch. the rooms were clean and tidy, fairly small, but when in Rome you are not spending much time in there anyway! breakfast was really very enjoyable. the man who served the coffees was ever so friendly and welcoming, and the food was wonderful. definately ask him to make you a cappacino, they are the best! location wise was great. we were a stone's throw away from Vatacian City and St Peters, and pretty much every atttraction was walkable. we did go on the metro line to the Colleseum, it is only one euro to travel for 90 mins on the metro which is fabulous. be careful though as they stop running much earlier then in London! there are many things to see and do in Rome, and the location of this hotel is fabulous. there were some lovely places tucked away near the river by St Peters which were a real jem. if you are thinking of going to Rome do it. it was amazing,and this hotel was truly lovely. thanks for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “THE Best”
Reviews.Author: doondog
Reviews.Content: My sister and I arrived at the hotel nearly five hours before check-in. The consierge, Fabrizio was most welcoming and our room was ready and waiting. Our bags were brought to the room and we enjoyed the first of many delicious cups of what we found to be THE best capuccino in all of Italy right in the breakfast room of Dei Consoli. You will find yourself rushing to get there in the morning, and disappointed when nowhere else can replicate it! The rooms are small if you are living out of your suitcase. However, there is plenty of closet space for your belongings and a private safe in the room as well. We joked that we needed a traffic cop to navigate the space between the foot of the beds and the mirror and table, but we overlooked that as the absolute cleanliness made up for it. Our bathroom had a stall shower, no bathtub and the fluffiest, softest towels you could ask for....and plenty of them. The hair dryer worked well which was a plus for us as even with the converters we brought, our dryers would not work, although I'm sure the front desk staff would have helped to solve the problem. All of the staff at the hotel was incredibly pleasant and helpful. They were willing to go out of their way to make our 4 night stay a pleasant one. The hotel is located one block from a large transportation hub which makes it quite easy to get around the city. You can walk to many sites, St.Peter's Square being the closest, in minutes. The purchase of a hop-on hop-off pass is something I would recommend as it enables you to see the sites by bus and get off and on as you please. They can be bought for use for a number of days. If you are looking for a delicious meal, a local sent us to a place near the American Embassy called LaCarbonara. It was the best meal we had in Rome. I can't remember the street name, only that it began with a P and the address number was 412. The food, I remember! When I return to Rome I will most definitely return to Hotel Dei Consoli. I have family visiting Rome in October and they are booking rooms based on our excellent experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: EAWBradford
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in a convenient location. Yes the room was a little small - but for the length of time you are actually in the room it's fine! The bathroom was clean and nice soft fluffy towels every day. The staff were very helpful and friendly - especially the waiter in the breakfast room who was especially pleasant. Breakfast was plentiful and had a good choice. The Vatican/St Peters Square is about 5 minutes walk away and the other attractions are easily accessible on foot or by Metro. One word of warning though - be very careful on the Metro with your valuables - unfortunately my husband had his wallet stolen on the Metro - thankfully not too much money was in the wallet but it was very inconvenient having to cancel the cards etc. It seems to be a very common occurence - so just be aware and be vigilant with your valuables! Rome is a lovely city to visit - plenty to do but make sure you've got comfy shoes! Overall the hotel was excellent value for what we paid and we would definitely stay there again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: CambsKango
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife with her parents stayed at the Hotel Consoli in June07. The stay iself was for 4 nights and was a suprise treat for the parents. location is excellent for the vatican (5 mins walk) and other sites via buses or taxis. The hotel was very clean but a rooms were a bit compact but the staff were all very welcoming apart from one woman on reception who I dont think knew what a smile was and was clueless. All the staff spoke very good english, they gave us good tips on local restaurants (would definately recommend "Amitriciano" which was just round the corner. The full breakfast was very good offering a good selection. The hotel is just off a main street which was good for shopping. Also, a good shop next door selling wicked Buffalo Mozzarella (if you like that sort of thing). Would also recommend the GTS tour bus which we picked up round the corner and was €16 each, tickets we got from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: katewcdf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March '07 for the Wales v Italy rugby international. Fabuous hotel in a great location in Rome - we walked everywhere. All the 'main sites' are within a reasonable walking distance if your relatively fit, and if you'd rather take the bus i would highly recommend one of the hop-on-hop-off tour buses that go from just outside St Peter's. We went on one one day and saw loads. Room & bathroom quite small but spotlessly clean and had everything you need. Breakfast was included in the rate we had, and was great, although there are plenty of cafes close by if you need them. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Try this side of the Tiber”
Reviews.Author: avb
Reviews.Content: Seven of us were here for 5 nights in April '07. I was somewhat sceptical since I usually like to stay in the historic center but since we planned to see the Vatican Museum and because of the high ratings on Tripadvisor (and we got a good deal through Expedia) we stayed at the Dei Consoli. Glad we did. Wonderful hotel- staff is outstanding. Fabrizio and Mario at the front desk and Fausto in the breakfast room are especially deserving of praise. Rooms are lovely, spotless and surprisingly quiet and yes, they are small but most in Rome are. Its a great spot from which to claim your place in line early for entrance to the Vatican Museum. Its a short walk to the Metro stop Ottavaino, but don't be afraid to try the bus routes as well- we were able to get everywhere quite easily using the 81 bus on the via Cola di Rienzo and the 492 on via Crescenzi, both a half block away. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: STICKGIRL
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. This is very close to st peters. i am reluctant to tell you how good it was as i think this is still a hidden gem. but you will not regret booking with dei consoli. i read all the trip reviews and this was one of the very few that did not have a bad one. now i know why. myself and partner travelled from belfast and were treated very well from our check in to departure. all staff were very helpful. rooms were immaculate and cleaned very day, towels were lovely and fresh, soft. tv had two english channels one of hwich was a sky movies.. just go up the channels till yu find it. this made it nice to relax on the comfy beds before heading out in the evening. borgo pio a street nearby is quite good for food. we walked eveywhere. and on a few occasions walked from the colleseum end back to hotel. the metro though is only a few blocks away. however the bus that runs from town to st peters is well known for its pick pockets so be warned... TIP - also beware of people asking you to take a photo of them as this is also a scam.. generally a couple looking like tourists ask you and while one shows you how to use the camers the other robs you.. they are long gone before you realise it!!!! back to the hotel. hotel standards alll over from breakfast to service, clean rooms etc and the roof terace... makes this worth the money. take the advice and pick this one. i will answer any questions if you want to check stuff

Reviews.Title: “Rome visit”
Reviews.Author: dralanir
Reviews.Content: Me and my daughters booked 2 Rooms for our week long stay in Rome to meet one of my old friends there. The Hotel location is great, walking distance to Vatican and most of Old Rome sites. Even though the rooms are small but they are clean and well maintaned. The staff nice and helpful. The Breakfast buffet is fresh and healthy. The coffee is great. We paid 265 euros per room per night, which I think is high for this property in Rome. My friends paid in the same Hotel 185 euros per room per night. But they booked with a travel agent. So you have to shop around befor you book through Hotel web site as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely and peaceful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JC78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February 2006 for four nights and would be hard pressed to find fault with this hotel. Whilst the rooms are small, this is fairly typical of italian hotels in general and what they lacked in size thay made up for in comfort. Whilst situated off a busy road in the heart of vatican city, the rooms were so peaceful and relaxing and the beds incredibly comfortable. Breakfast was the usual continental affair, but beautifully presented and the waiters were consistently helpful and pleasant. Whilst it is possilble to walk to all the major attractions Rome has to offer, it will take you a good half an hour by foot to reach the trevi fountain area of the city. On the other hand, castel s'ant angelo and the vatican museum, st peters etc are 5 mins away so it is a great base if you are wanting to spend a lot of time exploring this part of the city. Would definately return and in fact wish we had as when we returned to Rome in december '06 we booked hotel stendhal (piazza barberini area)purely for its more central location only to be almost ripped off by unscrupulous staff. Should've stuck with Hotel dei Consoli!

Reviews.Title: “very clean modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: SurreyJj
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights in rome staying in dei consoli hotel in ciampino not to be confused with hotel of same name in centre of rome. Very convienient for airport and bus stop outside straight to metro into centre of rome within 15 minutes and all for 2 euros! Beware buses can be very crowded. Hotel was very clean and modern breakfast was continental and staff helpful. All in all would recommend this hotel as it was very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our short stay”
Reviews.Author: Giovanni-7
Reviews.Content: We had a 4-night stay at Hotel dei Consoli from 28 February. The hotel is situated in a pleasant district of Rome on a busy shopping street (Via Cola di Reinzo). Although small, our room was spotlessly clean, well appointed and quiet, with good sound insulation both from the busy main road and neighbouring rooms. The members of staff were courteous and helpful at all times. A very good selection of food was available for breakfast, which was served in a small bar area. We found that the best way to explore Rome from this hotel was on foot. The only time that we used the Metro was on arrival and departure between the hotel and the Termini, from where the Terravision coach operates its transfer to/from the Ciampino Airport. The hotel is only about a 5 minute walk from Ottoviano station on Metro Line A. The Vatican Museums, St Peter’s Basilica and Castel Sant’Angelo are all just a short walk from the hotel. Across the river and a litte further afield are Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Quirinale, Spanish Steps and Piazza del Popolo, but all accessible in 20-30 minutes walking time from the hotel. Even further afield but still within comfortable walking distance are attractions such as the Piazza del Campidoglio, Roman Forum, Colosseum and Borghese Gallery. The hotel does not have a restaurant and, on three evenings, we enjoyed eating at the Zigaetana restaurant that is to be found on the opposite side of Via Cola di Reinzo (263) just a couple of minutes walk from the hotel. On the remaining evening we ate in central Rome so that we could wander around after sunset to catch some of the sights under night illumination. Overall this was an excellent base for exploring Rome and we thoroughly enjoyed our short stay at Hotel dei Consoli.

Reviews.Title: “Quietly luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Colombiana-Ingles
Reviews.Content: A late-booked stay in Rome meant hotel availability was running out fast. However, by searching and then booking via Tripadvisor we found Dei Consoli. Arriving late evening we were welcomed and accommodated swiftly and courteously. The room and facilities were very much up to scratch. The receptionist advised us where to eat (where Romans do) and it was really good - resaurant style. Despite overlooking the street the "quiet hotel" status was well deserved. Breakfast was good, served in the smallish bar area - quite cosy really. The hotel's location made visiting the Vatican really easy (five mins walk) and even the walk to the Collosseum took only about 40 mins, not rushing. All in all a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good base from which to explore a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: PeeSee
Reviews.Content: Booked a three night break in Rome for my girlfriend and I in Jan 07 to celebrate her birthday. As usual, used TripAdvisor to help me decide on somewhere to stay. The hotel is extremely clean and well kept, the buffet breakfast is more than adequate and all the staff are courteous and very helpful. Only real grumble (and it came as no surprise after reading reviews on this site) was the small room size; absolutely tiny! So much so that we couldn't even open our wardrobe doors fully due to their extremely close proximity to the bed. I'd have been hacked off if I was going to be spending much time in my room or if I was having an extended stay, however Rome is such a fantastic city that for a sightseeing break all you really need is a good location, a comfortable bed to crash in, and a decent bathroom The Dei Consoli fulfills these requirements spendidly. Rome is obviously packed full of sight-seeing opportunties - If you're particularly keen on the Vatican, then the hotel is within easy walking distance. In fact, most of Rome can be covered on foot if you're reasonably fit and healthy. (Having said that, public transport is reliable and cheap when the cobbled streets finally do take their toll, taxis aren't too expensive either). One important point about travelling around the city - the hotel is on a tiny street; make sure you pick up one of their business cards every time you go out because on more than one occasion we got into a taxi to return to the hotel and the driver didn't have a clue where to go! The hotel is also just round the corner from a stop off point of the 'Green Line' open-top bus tour, which you can hop on, hop off as and when you like. Highly recommend doing this. The hotel has a number of eateries and bars within easy walking distance. Top tip regarding eating out in Rome in general would be to avoid places that are closest to the main tourist sites as they tend to be seriously over-priced. Pick up a guide book and have a look at recommendations - try and eat where the locals eat and you won't go too far wrong. We found that dining out in Rome was consistently excellent and reasonably priced. A short break, therefore only a short review. To sum up, the Dei Consoli is billed as a four star hotel but I don't think it would have that rating if it were in a UK city due to the extremely small size of the rooms and the lack of any leisure facilities/restaurant. That said, it's a perfectly fine base from which to explore a wonderful city. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem!”
Reviews.Author: poppy888
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. It is so close to St Peters square and it is in a lovely shopping area! Rome was wonderful, the weekend was packed with sight seeing etc so it was always a pleasure to come home to our lovely hotel. We were on the third floor, the room was spacious and luxurious, we couldn't have asked for anything more. The staff were very pleasant and courteous. The breakfast was served in the bar, it was nothing spectacular, the usual breads, meats and cheeses, but it was beautifully presented and the fresh coffees were very welcome! We had dinner at a beautiful rooftop restaurant, the Hotel Forum, the food and staff were very pretentious, but the views over Rome were breathtaking...of course so was the bill!!! We had pre-booked a taxi to take us to and from the airport, I would really recommend this, especially as we met some people who had been charged atrocious prices, and others who claim they had been robbed! Some of the Taxis did not look too inviting, in fact I have seen better at a demolition derby! We were tired the first day, so took one of the tour buses around the sites, this is an excellent way of seeing everything, as you can get off and on at your chosen site, and the tickets last for 2 days. I had hoped to take a guided tour around the vatican, but it was impossible to find our guide in St Peters square!! There are so many quides with umbrellas and flags!!! We decided to pay the 6 euro for an audio guide and do it ourselves...it was great, no waiting about, just go and do things at your own pace. Remember if doing this you need ID, they accepted a credit card as it was all I had. We had the best weekend,Rome is the most wonderful city, the hotel was beautiful, stay here, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing City”
Reviews.Author: Michele2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a great location near St Peters and close to a metro station and good shopping. The staff were great and kept us well informed of all the best places to visit. The only grumbles were that we found the room to be very small, although to be honest we didnt spend a lot of time in our room so that wasnt too much of a problem but at night time it could be a little noisy as the window looked out onto a fairly busy main road. Breakfast was ok, nothing special. All said and done we had a great holiday, Rome is now my absolute favourite City, it is truly a wonderful place to visit and we hope to go back real soon!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect choice in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: HotelAdele
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time this November at the charming Hotel Dei Consoli. Laura, Mario and all the staff were so helpful. The location was great, just a short walk to the Vatican and museum, and surrounded by great shopping and people watching. The subway is right around the corner and it was very easy to get to all the top attractions in no time. The room itself was lovely, very clean and spotlessly maintained and we loved having the small Juliette balcony overlooking the avenue. The complimentary breakfast each morning was delicious and graciously served in a beautiful room with wonderful Italian music softly playing; a perfect way to start the day. We highly recommend the hotel and by the way, we also really liked the ziGitana restaurant across the street.

Reviews.Title: “A GEM”
Reviews.Author: coolsailor
Reviews.Content: We decided to book this hotel after reading trip advisor reports. The hotel lived up to the excellent reports in every way from helpful staff to quality of rooms and breakfast. The hotel is in a select area of Rome in a street full of quality shops and very close to The Vatican. A good way of getting from and to the airport is by Terrivision Bus to the main station Termini then by Metro to Ottivano which is only a 5min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: stormrx8
Reviews.Content: This perfect little hotel nestles in a side-street just a stones throw from the Vatican and excellent shopping. We were even in walking distance of the Coloseum, although the italian underground was very easy to use and cost next to nothing. The Hotel really lived up to its four star rating , with polite helpfull staff, excellent decor and clean well equipt rooms. We would definately choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect oasis.”
Reviews.Author: fergusonni
Reviews.Content: We loved this beautiful hotel. The staff went to every effort to make us feel welcome and helped with directions, maps, luggage at every opportunity. The hotel was wonderfully clean and the breakfasts were great. Don't miss the fresh cappucinos. The hotel is sited perfectly for visits to the Vatican and there is a Metro station a few hundred metres away for cheap and easy access to the rest of the city. Although reasonably priced, the hotel felt as if we were staying in much more expensive accomodation. October is a lovely month to visit and we hope to return to Dei Consoli soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: misshr
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this hotel and found it to be wonderful. It was very quiet, the air conditioning was great, and the staff were very helpful, especially the man who serves breakfast. The bedroom and bathroom were small but perfectly adequate, with a good shower. The breakfast was outstanding, with pastries, fruit, scrambled eggs, meat, cereals, etc. Just a short walk from the Vatican. We even walked back to the hotel all the way from the Colisseum, which is a hike but doable. Here's a tip - take advantage of the closeness to St. Peters and go there when it opens at 7 a.m. It was fantastic seeing this without any crowds around. Our traveling companions are not "morning people" and went later in the day, and were then quite envious of our experience.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little hotel near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Emmers00
Reviews.Content: I was actually booked at another hotel, and was bumped at the last minute to this one. I'm glad I was, because this hotel was quite nice. My room was small (average size for an older hotel in a city), but very nicely appointed - wood paneling, fantastic crown moulding, beautiful wallpaper, and soft sheets. Even though my room faced a busy street, it was very quiet, probably due to triple pane windows. The cable was good - several channels in English. Also, the breakfast was spectacular - I wish I hadn't been in such a hurry to leave and could have enjoyed it more. The only problem was that the front desk attendant on duty for most of my stay was very cranky. He spoke English, and I'm sure would have helped me if I'd asked for anything, but would just be sort of surly about it. I'd still definitely recommend the hotel as a nice, luxuriously appointed small hotel near the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: kengun
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after fleeing from an unacceptable booking. The location was perfect, staff accomidating, great clean room, and breakfast was great. Near public transport, or the desk can arrange taxi. 4 blocks from St peter's A bit pricey but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “my 50th birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: Bill&Gill
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We were on the 3rd floor and the view of the Via Cola di Rienzo (one of the main shopping streets) was entertaining but adequately silenced when we shut the window. The decoration is of a high standard, nothing distasteful, all very pleasing to the eye, very relaxing. It's 5 minutes from St Peters Square which is simply stunning at night. After visiting the wonders of Rome during the day, the Hotel room is heaven to relax in and cool off. (it had been 40 degrees, to Hot!!). The air con is a blessing. The room was very clean and comfortable, the bathroom had all the facilities you require. After an exhausting day, we recommend the resturant just over the road from the hotel. They will save you a table. Breakfast was tasty and well presented and the waiter is a lovely man, very helpful as are the rest of the staff. If we ever go back, we would like the same room 305 please.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aprilrays
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. My first time in Rome. Staff was very pleasant and informative. Breakfast was very good. Close to the Vatican. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: fawnio
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth the money. Great service, really friendly staff and beautiful breakfast spread. Just a stones throw away from the vatican, and right beside one of the best shopping districts. The ottaviano metro stop is just 2 minutes walk away which will take you straight to many of the attractions and for 1euro per journey you cant complain. Every night we walked around st peters square before going home and it was beautiful. The hotel rooms have a minibar and great room service with a fancy little bar downstairs. The rooms were cleaned and fully made up every day and the cleaning staff were so nice. definitely go back here if i ever get the chance!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for weekend break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has a very high standard, friendly service,Quality rooms and an excellant location.We traveled from Dublin for a weekend and had a totally enjoyable stay in this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PandaScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Consoli for a long weekend. The hotel is ideally placed for trips to St Peter's and the Vatican Museum but be warned on the latter, arrive really early as the queues can be horrendous. The reception was fast and efficient, the rooms are not big but they are stylish, very clean and the showers excellent. I echo an earlier comment that the breakfasts are fine but don't be late as they do tend to run out of essentials. Opposite the hotel is a little trattoria with cheap and simple meals which is much favoured by the locals and there are many other restaurants within walking distance. All in all a very nice little boutique hotel in an ideal location for visiting Rome which I recommend to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel! Close to Vatican and only 20 minute walk to the Spannish Steps and other attractiona. There was a nice restaurant not far away. The hotle is very close to a major shopping area. Our room was very clean and quite, but small. Staff was helpful and responsive. We visited Florence for three days and they hold our extra luggage in a storage place unitl we came back. Breakfast was o.k., I wish we had more selection..

Reviews.Title: “Compact & Bijou ....”
Reviews.Author: joox
Reviews.Content: Great location for sightseeing, very close to St. Peters. On a busy shopping street with couple of good restaurants nearby. Only drawbacks are, no restaurant and rooms quite small..so you don't want to stay in much! Minor niggles, but you would have to pay more, or stay further out to get better facilities. The great news is that Rome getes six stars!

Reviews.Title: “Next door to the vatican”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before I start to talk about the hotel. A word ot WARNING!! At the airport we showed the taxi driver the details of our hotel. After a round the world tour we realised, with a little arguement from the taxi driver, that there are two Hotel Dei Consoli's in Rome. One near the airport and one near the Vaticam. YOU DON'T KNOW HOW RELEIVED WE WHERE TO FIND THIS OUT AFTER SEEING HOW FAR THE FIRST ONE WAS FROM ROME!! Could not complain about this hotel in any way. Booked it as it was so near to the Vatican and not knowing Rome. Pleasant and very helpful staff. Recommeded places to go. Where to buy subways tickets etc. Could not complain. Was within walking distance, but if you don't fancy the walk the subway was a couple of minutes walk away. We found in the evening that there was no need to go into the centre of Rome to eat as there where a couple of very good restaurants a couple of streets back from the hotel, which where alot cheaper than dining in the centre of Rome. HINT>> Dont drink pints of beer if you are looking for a bargain. Bottles of wine are definately the cheapest option! WE STAYED IN THREE HOTELS ON OUR VISIT TO ITALY AND THIS WAS BY FAR THE ONE WE FELT AT HOME IN...

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was great, the location was excellent and we walked everywhere. I have to agree with everyone else the bedroom was tiny even by english standards but we were hardly in it and the bed was a good size but a little hard for my taste. The bathroom was spotlessly clean and finished in beautiful marble and wood. The breakfast was more than sufficent and the staff were very friendly and helpful especially the young man on reception who was full of intresting information. We asked the hotel to book a transfer from the airport to the hotel, it was wonderful being picked up by a smart suited gentleman in a mercedes. he was most informative and gave us a mini tour of the city before taking us to the hotel. We found some good restaurants near the hotel that were not too expensive, the pizzas and pasta are great and the wine is cheaper by the bottle and tastes good too. My favourite part of the trip was just wandering around finding places without really looking for them, there are magnificent churches and statues everywhere, the whole atmosphere is brilliant especially at night when the whole place just comes alive. This was one of my favourite trips and I would certainly recommend Rome and this Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little gem in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: sbercher
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading the excellent reviews on this site. It wasn't the cheapest option, but I can really say that it was worth every extra euro! The hotel is located close to the Vatican and is a good base to explore the area's museums and landmarks. The "Ancient Rome" is about a 20 minutes' walk through nice streets, passing in front of the beautiful "Angels" Castle and accross the river. But what made our stay more exceptional was the friendliness of the staff. All of them, from the receptionist -which we heard speaking Spanish, French, German and English- to the breakfast room employees were genuinely helpful and friendly, something not so common in Rome. The public areas were richly decorated with Italian antiques and the breakfast room had a small terasse overlooking a quiet side street. The bedroom was not the biggest, but absolutely adequate, and again decorated with very good taste. Everything was working fine (TV, AC etc...) and the marble bathroom was in perfect condition, though it only had a shower - this is a historic building and it would be a shame if they demolished 500-years old walls to make room for a bath tub. My verdict is that it's a perfect place for a quiet, cultural stay, away from the noise and pollution from the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in a Great Location near the Vatican and St. Peters”
Reviews.Author: GuyinSF
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and I stayed here on September 3, 2005. We were greeted by a porter who made sure our luggage was delivered to our room. The hotel is beautiful. We paid 120 euros for the night. Unfortunately, we were to have two twin beds, but only a king was available. The room was very clean and the air conditioning worked great. The hotel exceeded my expectations, especially for the price. The only down side was the room was on the side of the hotel and faced the main street and I could hear the cars zooming by all night long. It didn't keep me a wake, but woke me up a couple of times. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, but would ask that the room be located away from the traffice noise of the main street. The hotel is in a great location to the Vatican and St Peters. Lots of shops for shopping and several restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Tried to stay longer!”
Reviews.Author: JChapma
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights at the Dei Consoli and absolutely loved it! We searched everywhere for affordable hotels in Rome, and were really shocked by the cost of some of the more famous ones. We stumbled upon the Dei Consuli on your website, and couldn't find any really bad reviews. We took a chance on it, and we're so thrilled that we did. When we checked in, we were expecting the world's smallest hotel room (after the reviews). We were pleasantly suprised by how nice the rooms were. They certainly weren't as big as the rooms in the States, but were much larger than the rooms in our London hotel. It was very nicely furnished and very, very clean (which is always our most important criteria). The front desk staff, breakfast guy, and maids couldn't have been more friendly! They offered a lot of good suggestions for getting around the city, and seemed willing to do almost anything to help us. When we finally left Rome and headed to Florence, we realized what a great place the Dei Consuli was. We were dissapointed with our Florence accomodations, and tried to return to Rome a day early to get back to "our little hotel." We'd strongly recommend it to anyone looking for a cost effective but charming hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Dei Consoli is a treasure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at Hotel Dei Consoli in late February of this year. It is small but beautifully furnished. The rooms are spacious - a queen bed with full bath and closet in the room, with plenty of room to move around. Out of our window we could see the dome of St. Peter's. The daily breakfast was served in a lovely small dining area, with both American and European spreads. The espresso was some of the best we had during our entire visit right there in the hotel. Ask the concierge for restaurant recommendations, we did every night and never had even an 'ok' meal, every suggested restaurant was really, really great. All within walking distance, which we were not excepting since every guide book we had said the area around the Vatican had poor dining. Avoid the obvious tourist traps (pictures of the food posted outside!) and you'll be fine. The concierge also set up our transportation to and from the airport for us via email before we left the States. Again, staff was incredibly kind and helpful. It is very conveniently located, a short walk to the subway and a bus about a block away. The Vatican is about a 5 block walk. We walked the entire city and couldn't have been happier. We are planning to come back for another visit and will definitely stay there again for the value (we booked a air/hotel package through Travelocity)

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Galonherown
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in April 2005. This was a nice hotel in a nice location. The room was way too small for two people, which is the norm in Europe. A little on the expensive side, therefore the reason why we booked a "cheaper (smaller) room" . The hotel itself is quite small, but tasteful. The bathroom was a nice size. Other than the very cramped room, the other complaint was that it was uncomfortably stuffy, temperature wise. They don't turn on the air conditioner at that time of year, and it was too noisy to open the window at night. I didn't have breakfast, but my traveling companion gave it a definite thumbs up. We were traveling with a tour and opted to move to this hotel after the tour had completed. We liked the Dei Consoli, but debated whether we should have stayed in our "tour hotel" for the last couple of days. The tour hotel was farther out of town, not as nice or conveniently located as the Dei Conoli, but it was cheaper, much roomier, and had a shuttle service into town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: FrequentPoipuVisitor
Reviews.Content: We had a most enjoyable and very restful six night stay at the four star Hotel dei Consoli in May. Everything about it was very enjoyable and after long flights with many time zone difference it was a haven. The hotel is in a lovingly converted former mansion and beneath the elegant surface everything is totally modern and up-to-date. Our room had more than adequate air conditioning, good lighting and several data ports. A shelf in the bathroom for our toiletries would have been nice as there was no vanity-sink. Overall the room itself had a sumptuous, classy feeling. The staff, especially Mario and Raffaella, were alway helpful and polite. Though it bills itself as a business hotel, the Hotel dei Consoli would more than satisfy most visitors to Rome. It is located in the Prati neighborhood just about five to ten minute walk to the Vatican. The nice thing about this area is that is not so tourist trodden as so many other Rome hotels are and there are plenty of shops and good restaurants within easy walking distance. We walked all over the area day and night without incident. Our room was cozy, not large being of about average size for a four star Roman hotels and it was very clean and well kept. We enjoyed many sidewalk bars and restaurants in the Trastevere area. Good food, good people watching, the latter especially in the bars fronting on the piazza of the Santa Maria Trastevere church. Things about Rome that could have been better: A small number of the otherwise reliable Roman cab drivers may try to overcharge you. Look at the meter before alighting; we had one guy who wanted to double charge us. All other cab drivers we encountered were honest. Also we felt, perhaps incorrectly, that a recommended restaurant, which is not part of the hotel, the Quatro Mori (located sort of behind the left side of the St. Peters) was a "tourist trap" despite other online comments to the contrary. The waiter repeatedly refused to give us menus saying they were not necessary (an ideal setup for getting and paying more than you anticipate), service was not particularly attentive, timely or polite, the food was marginal not great except my wife's salad mista which was very poorly prepared being merely a tray of whole, unchopped vegetables, though they were fresh. I tired to buy a bottle of fine wine but failed and the bottle they brought was a house brand and not good. When our bill finally arrived the waiter rather brusquely informed us service was not included though I noticed the local patrons did not leave a gratuity. We gave a tip without arguing and left never to return. Desolate beggars (most appear to be fakes) and pickpocket scammers are not uncommon in the tourist areas. Watch your purse and wallet. We saw a tug-of-war involving a Japanese tourist and gypsy girls who had used the ruse of holding an unintelligible sign in the tourist's face while another was trying to grab her purse. The tourist won! It would seem Rome's police could stop these things with a few decoy operations but it seems the status quo rules. None of this changed our enjoyment of the city and the traffic is not as crazy as the guidebooks say. But back to the Hotel dei Consoli - most enjoyable. Stay there you will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a city break”
Reviews.Author: trainer
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, spotlessly clean, friendly staff, in a great location for exploring the city. There is a small bar on the first floor but apart from that there are no other facilities i.e. gym etc. What you get is a really good base in a great location to enjoy the city. We found this area a bit quieter at night with lots of police around probably beacuse of it being so close to the Vatican so it felt safe. There are lots of really good restaurants near the hotel and the prices in this area are a lot cheaper than in the main tourist areas across the river. About 10-15 mins gentle stroll would take you into the busier areas. Everything is within easy reach either by foot or by local transport. I tend to be fussy but I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel really close to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay near the Vatican, this place is a very good choice. The hotel is very nice, well decorated and up-to-date with very clean rooms. Rooms are very small, but welcome to Europe! You can walk to most of the main Rome sites in about a 10-minute, pleasant walk. Breakfast is in a pretty room, but is nothing special. I would recommend this hotel to those who want to stay near the Vatican, but not to those that really want to stay in the "heart of it". If that's your bag, stay near the Spanish Steps- if you can afford it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and location”
Reviews.Author: aaa78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at dei Consoli on our first visit to Rome this spring. The hotel was first class. Yes the rooms are small but are beautifully appointed and the shower room was superb. Breakfasts were delicious with such friendly service. Nothing was too much trouble and we could not have been made more welcome. We enjoyed being on the quieter side of the river and certainly did not find it a problem to find good eating houses. We would defintely go back on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: CentralNYTraveler
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews about this hotel at this site, my husband and I stayed here for 6 days in March. A small hotel, with elegant decor and a fabulous breakfast. We were lucky enough to be greeted by the nicest clerk, Mario. He was so welcoming that he set the tone for the rest of our stay (we did see the cold young lady who was mentioned in the other reviews and we were glad she did not greet us!) The hotel is small and is on the other side of the Tiber away from the hustle and bustle. If you are looking for grand lobbies, this is not the place for you. The Vatican is an easy stroll, and we walked to St. Peter's Square after dinner each night. We walked and used buses and the metro. We even took the metro from the airport. We stayed in a standard room and did not have the luxury of the Jaccuzi mentioned by another reviewer. Rooms are small, and if one is prepared for this it will not be a shock when you see the size of the room. However, the room was clean and beautifully decorated and very elegant. We loved the towel warmers in the bathroom. We can honestly say that breakfast was one of the best meals we had. . . fabulous cappuchino and the server was the nicest young man. One morning he made me three cappuchinos. I am so used to the large cups of coffee that the tiny cappuchino cups did not do it for me. Also, once we found out that it cost us Euro 3.50 for a cup of cappuchino we really enjoyed our morning coffee. Breakfast consisted of cheeses, pastries, scrambled eggs, ham, cereal, yogurt and fresh fruit. We filled up on breakfast and made do with Gelato and fruit for lunch and had a good meal for dinner. Speaking of dinner the two restaurants mentioned on this site were excellent; Ristorante Zigaetana (263 via cola de renzo) fabulous antipasti casa of artichoke hearts and zucchini flowers, and Il Matriciano (55 Via dei Gracchi) fabulous appetizer of grilled eggplant and fresh mozzarella. Both restaurants are 10 mins. walking distance. The McDonald's at the Spanish steps has a cafe downstairs away from the hustle and bustle and a quiet place to sit and enjoy a cup of cappuchino (only 85 cents). If you don't want the basket of bread or the bottle of water ask the waiter to take it away, otherwise it will cost you! As an aside, we must be the only couple who were not impressed with the food in Rome other than the two mentioned. Either we didn't know where to dine or we have strange tastes. We get such fabulous food in America that we found the food mediocre. The pizza crust in Rome was wafer thin and was a plus point but the toppings weren't anything to rave about. The cappuchino is excellent, but when you can't sit down and enjoy it beacuse it costs double the price, Starbucks seems cheap. In fact everything in America seemed cheap once we started converting Euros to dollars. So, try not to do this, and think of a cup of coffee as 3.50 and not $5.00! The sights are fabulous and enjoy every moment of it. PS: I used Rick Steves Rome guide and found it very useful for the sights.
